colspan=6 | Dimensions |- | style="text-align:right;"| '''Overall Length''' | colspan=5 | {{convert|3795|mm|in|1|abbr=on}} |- | style="text-align:right;"| '''Overall Width''' | colspan=5 | {{convert|1680|mm|in|1|abbr=on}} (without ORVM) |- | style="text-align:right;"| '''Overall Height''' | colspan=5 | {{convert|1427|mm|in|1|abbr=on}} |- | style="text-align:right;"| '''Wheel Base''' | colspan=5 | {{convert|2489|mm|in|1|abbr=on}} |- | style="text-align:right;"| '''Ground Clearance''' | colspan=5 | {{convert|168|mm|in|1|abbr=on}} |- | style="text-align:right;"| '''Fuel Tank Capacity (litres)''' | colspan=5 | 45 |- | style="text-align:right;"| '''Turning radius''' | colspan=5 | 4.9 m |- | style="text-align:right;"| '''Boot Space (litres) | colspan=5 | 284 |} ===Production=== The Ford Figo is manufactured at Ford's plant in Chennai, Tamil Nadu, India. The 100,000th Ford Figo produced for the Indian market was delivered 15 months after its launch.{{cite web|url=http://www.zigwheels.com/news-features/news/ford-celebrates-100000-figo-sales/8833/1|title=Zigwheels - Ford Celebrates 100,000 Figo Sales|accessdate=2012-09-06}} The 200,000th Figo was sold during August 2012, after 29 months of production,{{cite web|url=http://www.cardekho.com/india-car-news/ford-india-registers-16-growth-in-august-2012-8637.htm|title=Ford Celebrates 200,000 Figo Sales|accessdate=2012-09-06}} while the 300,000th Figo was made in first week of August 2013, after 41 months of production.[http://www.india.ford.com/about/media/newsroom/result?article=1249043932129 300,000th Ford Figo] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130907031753/http://www.india.ford.com/about/media/newsroom/result?article=1249043932129 |date=7 September 2013 }} ===Braking and handling=== The Ford Figo has ventilated discs at front and drum rear brakes. The top variant comes with an [[Anti-lock braking system]] (ABS) with [[Electronic brakeforce distribution]] (EBD) which enhances the safety of the car by helping it stop in emergency situations. ===Safety=== During a crash, the Figo's engine automatically falls from the bonnet area to prevent the car from catching fire. Dual front airbags are available on a premium package. ===Awards=== The Figo has been awarded 20 Indian auto industry awards, more honours than any other car in 2010.{{cite web|url=http://www.cardekho.com/india-car-news/ford-figo-is-the-most-awarded-car-in-india-in-2010-3702.htm|title=Ford Figo is the Most Awarded Car in India in 2010|accessdate=2012-09-06}}{{cite web|url=http://www.motorbeam.com/cars/ford-figo/ford-figo-win-20-awards/|title=Ford & Figo Win 20 Awards|accessdate=2012-09-06|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120925062649/http://www.motorbeam.com/cars/ford-figo/ford-figo-win-20-awards/|archive-date=25 September 2012|url-status=dead}} The Ford Figo was voted the 2011 Indian Car of the Year by a panel of leading automotive magazine editors.{{cite news|url=http://articles.economictimes.indiatimes.com/2010-12-16/news/27601097_1_ford-figo-ford-india-year-award|title=Ford Figo wins 2011 Indian Car of the Year Award|accessdate=2012-09-06 | work=The Times Of India|date=16 December 2010}} It was also named runner-up in the 2011 South African Car of the Year Awards.{{cite web|url=http://www.carmag.co.za/news/sa-car-of-the-year-2011-its-a-tie/ |title=SA Car of the Year 2011: It's a tie! |publisher=Car magazine|date=2011-03-09 |accessdate=2013-06-23}} ===Marketing controversy=== A series of Ford Figo print ads were created by [[J. Walter Thompson|JWT India]], including a caricature of former Italian Prime Minister [[Silvio Berlusconi]] in the driver's seat with three scantily clad women sitting gagged and bound in the trunk, a [[Paris Hilton]] caricature winking from the driver's seat while [[Kim Kardashian]] and two others are gagged in the boot, and a caricatured [[Michael Schumacher]] with [[Sebastian Vettel]], [[Lewis Hamilton]] and [[Fernando Alonso]] lookalikes gagged in the back. All three featured the same tagline: "Leave your worries behind".{{cite web|author=Anant Rangaswami |url=http://www.firstpost.com/business/how-jwt-scam-ads-got-ford-india-in-a-mess-673822.html |title=How JWT scam ads got Ford India in a mess |publisher=Firstpost.com |date= |accessdate=2013-06-23}} The print ads were not approved by Ford, but were used as speculative renderings to promote the agency.{{cite web|author=Laura Stampler |url=http://www.businessinsider.com/awful-ford-figo-ad-silvio-berlunsconi-gagged-women-2013-3 |title=Silvio Berlusconi With A Trunk Full Of Tied-Up Women: Worst Ford Ad Ever? |publisher=Businessinsider.com |date=2013-03-21 |accessdate=2013-06-23}} JWT breached trust and used an approval from Ford to use other poster ads made for Ford as a tacit approval to enter the adverts into the GoaFest 2013 Advertising awards and adsoftheworld.com. Ivan Razl of adsoftheworld.com confirmed that the ads were removed according to the rules of the website as the letter was only a generic approval and the said ads were not approved, which was confirmed to him by JWT. After the publication of the ads, Ford responded by stating that the posters were contrary to the standards of professionalism and decency within Ford and its agency partners.{{cite news|last=Welsh |first=Jonathan |url=https://blogs.wsj.com/drivers-seat/2013/03/23/ford-apologizes-for-offensive-berlusconi-figo-ads/ |title=Ford Apologizes for Offensive 'Berlusconi' Figo Ads |publisher=Blogs.wsj.com |date=2013-03-23 |accessdate=2013-06-23}} JWT India's parent, [[WPP plc]], apologized for the adverts.{{cite news|last=Philip |first=Siddharth |url=https://www.bloomberg.com/news/2013-03-25/ford-apologizes-after-mock-ads-of-berlusconi-tying-up-women.html |title=Ford Apologizes After Mock Ads of Berlusconi Tying Up Women |publisher=Bloomberg.com |date=2013-03-25 |accessdate=2013-06-23}} After the incident, JWT India chief creative officer and managing partner Bobby Pawar and Blue Hive creative director Vijay Simha Vellanki resigned; and a further ten employees were reported to have been laid off.{{cite news|last=Thirani Bagri |first=Neha |url=http://india.blogs.nytimes.com/2013/04/01/indias-ad-industry-shaken-after-ford-figo-controversy/ |title=India's Ad Industry Shaken After Ford Figo Controversy|publisher=nytimes.com |date=2013-04-01 |accessdate=2013-06-23}} ==Second generation (2015-2019)== {{Infobox automobile | image = Ford Figo Second Generation (2016).jpg | name = Second generation | aka = [[Ford Ka]]
Ford Ka+ (Europe)
Ford Figo Aspire (sedan, India) | production = 2015–present | assembly = India: [[Sanand]], [[Gujarat]] ([[Ford India Private Limited|Ford India]]) | engine = {{convert|1499|cc|cuin|abbr=on}} ''1.5l Ti-VCT (Petrol)''

5-speed manual mated to 1.2l Ti-VCT (Petrol) and 1.5l TDCi (Diesel) | layout = | related = [[Ford Fiesta#Fiesta Mark VI (2008–2017):The sixth generation|Ford Fiesta]] Mk VI | body_style = 5-door [[hatchback]]
4-door [[sedan (automobile)|sedan]] | wheelbase = {{convert|2491|mm|in|1|abbr=on}} | length = {{convert|3886|mm|in|1|abbr=on}} (hatchback)
{{convert|3995|mm|in|1|abbr=on}} (Aspire)
{{convert|4254|mm|in|1|abbr=on}} (sedan) | width = {{convert|1695|mm|in|1|abbr=on}} | height = {{convert|1525|mm|in|1|abbr=on}} | weight = {{convert|1037|-|1041|kg|lb|0|abbr=on}} | sp = uk }} [[File:Ford Figo Second Generation (2016) 2.jpg|thumb|left|Ford Figo Second Generation (2016)]] [[File:Ford - Figo Aspire - Sub-4m Compact Sedan - Kolkata 2015-09-15 3721.JPG|thumb|left|Ford Figo Aspire]] Ford India launched the second generation Figo in 2015, six years after the initial launch.{{cite web|url=http://www.zigwheels.com/reviews-advice/reviews/2015-ford-figo-hatchback-test-drive-review/23182/ |title=Ford Figo : Detailed Review |work=zigwheels.com |date=2015-09-24 |accessdate=2016-05-08}} ===Engines=== The second generation Figo is available in three engine options. The 1.2-litre petrol unit makes 88PS and 112Nm and comes mated to a 5-speed manual transmission. Ford also has a larger 1.5-litre petrol on offer which is only offered with a 6-speed [[Dual-clutch transmission]]. This unit makes 112PS and 136Nm. And lastly, there is also a 1.5-litre diesel, churning 100PS and 215 Nm. Also, on offer, is Figo S, a more performance oriented version of the Figo. It includes a more stiff suspension setup, along with a rear sway bar and bigger wheels to improve the dynamic nature of the car. ===Variants / Trim Levels=== {| class="wikitable collapsible" style="font-size:93%; text-align:center;" |- !Variants!! Base !! Ambiente !! Trend !! Titanium !! Titanium |- | style="text-align:right;"| '''Market''' | colspan=5 | India |- ! colspan=6 | Powertrain Combination |- | style="text-align:right;"| '''1.2l Ti-VCT Petrol MT''' || Y || Y || Y || Y || Y |- | style="text-align:right;"| '''1.5l Ti-VCT Petrol AT''' || - || - || - || Y || - |- | style="text-align:right;"| '''1.5l TDCi Diesel MT''' || Y || Y || Y || Y || Y |- ! colspan=6 | Safety |- | style="text-align:right;"| '''[[Anti-lock braking system|ABS]] with EBD*''' || - || - || Y || Y || Y |- | style="text-align:right;"| '''ESP** + TCS*** + HLA****''' || - || - || - || Y (Only AT) || - |- | colspan=6 | *Electronic brakeforce distribution, **Electronic stability program (ESP), ***Electric power-assisted steering (EPAS), ****Hill Launch Assist (HLA) |- ! colspan=6 | Infotainment & Connectivity |- | style="text-align:right;"| '''MyFord Dock''' || - || - || Y || Y || Y |- | style="text-align:right;"| '''4.2" MFD Screen''' || - || - || - || - || Y |- | style="text-align:right;"| '''#SYNC (with Voice Control) & AppLink''' || - || - || - || - || Y |- | style="text-align:right;"| '''Ford MyKey''' || - || - || - || - || Y |- |} ===Safety=== All variants are offered with dual-front airbags except the base variant, which only has a driver-side [[airbag]]. The top-end variant gets six airbags in total.{{cite web|url=http://indianexpress.com/article/auto-travel/launches/new-ford-figo-launched-in-india/#sthash.o7fEDlIy.dpuf |title=New Ford Figo launched in India|date=2015-09-23 |accessdate=2016-05-15}} ===Suspension=== Independent [[MacPherson strut]] with coil spring and anti-roll bar up front work in tandem with semi independent twist beam with twin gas and oil filled shock absorbers at the rear.{{cite web|url=http://www.autocarindia.com/auto-reviews/ford-figo-review-road-test-398460,2.aspx |title=Ford Figo Review 2015 |work=autocarindia.com |date=2015-11-12 |accessdate=2016-05-08}} ===Front Grille=== The second generation Figo comes with "[[Aston Martin]]-esque"{{cite web|url=http://www.carscoops.com/2012/09/ford-grafts-aston-martin-esque-front.html |title=Ford Grafts an Aston Martin-esque Front Grille to 2013 Fiesta Facelift |date=2012-09-05 |accessdate=2016-05-15}} Front Grilles. On the top end trims Titanium and Titanium+, the slats/bars and the grille surround are chrome plated. The lower trims get either Black or Silver painted grilles and grille surround. [[File:Ford Figo LHD variant.jpg|thumb|201x201px|LHD variant (Prototype 2018) ]] ===Equipment=== Equipment highlights for the Figo include the MyFord Dock, first introduced on the Figo Aspire, which allows occupants to easily charge their smart-devices and also use the same for navigation. ===Colours/Colors=== The second gen Ford Figo is offered with 7 paint options. ===Recalls=== Ford India issued a statement saying that they had initiated a voluntary recall for approximately 42,300 units of the new Figo and the Figo Aspire owing to problems in the Restraint Control Module (RCM).{{cite web|url=http://auto.ndtv.com/news/ford-recalls-over-40-000-units-of-figo-and-figo-aspire-1398020 |title=Ford Recalls Over 40,000 Units of Figo and Figo Aspire |work=ndtv.com |date=2015-04-22 |accessdate=2016-05-15}} The software issue on the RCM can result in airbags not deploying in certain collisions. This may lead to loss of life. Ford stated that they will be carrying out software upgrade on the RCM on all affected vehicles across the country, free of cost. The recall applied to Figo and Figo Aspire units manufactured since the launch of both the vehicles until 12 April 2016. ===Production Volumes=== Ford India initially targeted 20,000 units / month of average output for Figo and Figo Aspire from the [[Sanand]], [[Gujarat]] plant. However reports{{cite web|url=http://www.moneycontrol.com/news/cnbc-tv18-comments/ford-cuts-production-targetwakeslow-figo-aspire-sales_6254981.html |title=Poor Figo, Aspire sales tests Ford's multi-product India plan |work=moneycontrol.com |date=2015-04-18 |accessdate=2016-05-15}} indicated that Figo hatchback's sales declined by 60 per cent between October 2015 and March 2016, while the Figo Aspire's sales went down 74 per cent from its launch in August 2015 and March 2016. This led to slash in production to 10,800 units a month. === {{anchor|Freestyle}} Freestyle=== In 2018, a CUV variant of the Figo was introduced, known as the Ford Freestyle. It is slotted between the Figo hatchback and the [[Ford EcoSport|EcoSport]]. It is available with a 1.2-litre petrol engine and a 1.5-litre diesel engine. Both engines are mated to a 5-speed manual transmission. The starting price is Rs 5.81 lakh. It is available in the following trims: Ambiente, Trend+, Titanium and Titanium+.{{cite web|url=https://www.businesstoday.in/sectors/auto/ford-freestyle-india-price-engine-features-variants/story/275662.html |title=Ford Freestyle launched in India: Price, engine, features and variants explained |date=2018-04-27 |accessdate=2018-12-29}} ==References== {{reflist|2}} ==External links== * [http://www.india.ford.com/cars/figo Ford Figo (India)] * [http://www.me.ford.com/en/sau/cars/figo Ford Figo (Middle East)] * [http://www.india.ford.com/cars/figoaspire Ford Figo Aspire (India)] {{Ford}} {{Ford India Timeline}} {{Use dmy dates|date=July 2011}} [[Category:Ford vehicles|Figo]] [[Category:Cars introduced in 2015]] [[Category:Subcompact cars]] [[Category:Front-wheel-drive vehicles]] [[Category:Hatchbacks]]

[[Ford Falcon (Australia)#Falcon utility|Ford Falcon ute]] (Australia) | successor = | sp = uk }} The current generation of the '''Ford Ranger''' (codenamed '''T6''') is a range of midsize [[pickup truck]]s that is manufactured and sold by [[Ford Motor Company]]. Designed and engineered by [[Ford Australia|Ford of Australia]],{{cite news|url=http://www.dailytelegraph.com.au/business/companies/meet-the-factory-workers-in-thailand-that-will-take-our-jobs-once-australias-car-manufacturing-industry-closes/news-story/576545b39f5ce34f014defcce8135da5|title=Meet the factory workers in Thailand that will take our jobs once Australia’s car manufacturing industry closes|date=1 Oct 2016|work=The Daily Telegraph (Sydney Australia)|publisher=News Corp. Australia|last2=Sainsbury|first2=Michael|last1=Dowling|first1=Joshua|accessdate=3 October 2016}} the current generation consolidated worldwide production of the Ranger onto a single platform, replacing the [[Ford Ranger (Americas)|1998-2012 Ranger]] (of North/South America){{cite web|url=http://news.pickuptrucks.com/2010/10/first-look-all-new-2011-ford-ranger-t6-global-pickup-truck-debuts.html|title=First Look: All-New 2011 Ford Ranger "T6" Global Pickup Truck|last=Levine|first=Mike|publisher=PickupTrucks.com|accessdate=7 August 2011}} and the [[Mazda BT-50|Mazda-derived Ford Ranger]] sold in Latin America, Europe and Asia-Pacific regions. First unveiled at the [[Australian International Motor Show]] in Sydney in October 2010, the Ranger T6 has been produced since the summer of 2011. Initially excluded from sale in the United States and Canada, Ford commenced sales of the Ranger T6 in these two markets in January 2019. Although a mid-size truck, the model line is again slotted below the Ford F-150 in the Ford truck range. Outside of North America, Mazda sells a restyled version of the Ranger as the Mazda BT-50 pickup truck. Alongside the upcoming [[Ford Bronco]], the third generation [[Ford Everest]] SUV and [[Troller T4]] (from 2014) off-road vehicle are derived from the Ranger T6. The Ford Ranger is produced across several facilities worldwide. First produced by the [[AutoAlliance Thailand|AutoAlliance]] facility in [[Rayong|Rayong, Thailand]], production is also sourced from [[Ford Motor Argentina|Ford Argentina]] in [[General Pacheco|General Pacheco, Argentina]], [[Nigeria]] and [[South Africa]].{{cite web|url=http://www.trucktrend.com/features/news/2010/163_news101014_new_global_ford_ranger/index.html|title=New Global Ford Ranger Unveiled, Still Not Planned for U.S.|last=Kong|first=Benson|publisher=Truck Trend|accessdate=7 August 2011}} North American production is sourced from the [[Michigan Assembly Plant]] in [[Wayne, Michigan]]. == Overview == Following its 2006-2011 predecessor in the mid-size segment, the Ford Ranger T6 is produced in three body styles worldwide. A two-door (single-cab) is standard, with a cargo capacity of {{convert|1.21|m3|cuft|order=flip}}. A cargo capacity of {{convert|1.82|m3|cuft|order=flip}} is offered with a four-door extended cab (SuperCab in North America), or a four-door crew cab (SuperCrew in North America). Along with the standard pickup truck, the Ranger is also offered as a chassis cab, effectively taking the place of the Ford Falcon cab-chassis. All four-door Rangers have the same ground clearance, whether two-wheel drive or four-wheel drive; two-door versions are offered with a "Hi-Rider" option in two-wheel drive configuration, giving them the same ground clearance as 4x4 versions. Hi-Rider versions (including the Wildtrak) have water-fording clearance of {{convert|800|mm|in|abbr=on|order=flip}}, while standard-height Rangers have clearance of {{convert|600|mm|in|abbr=on|order=flip}}. The Ranger T6 has a rated towing capacity of {{convert|3500|kg|lb|abbr=on|order=flip}}; versions with the 2.2L Duratorq diesel have a payload capacity of {{convert|1333|kg|lb|abbr=on|order=flip}}. In 2015, the Ford Ranger T6 underwent a mid-cycle redesign, with the front fascia adopting elements of [[Ford Kinetic Design]].{{cite web|url=http://gearheads.org/the-new-2016-ford-ranger/|title=New Ford ranger}} In place of the rectangular three-bar grille, the Ranger adopted a slightly oval grille with a single center bar, allowing further differentiation between the Ranger and the mechanically similar [[Ford Everest]] SUV. '''Pre-facelift styling''' 2015 Ford Ranger (PX) XL Hi-Rider 4-door utility (2015-11-11) 01.jpg|Front 2015 Ford Ranger (PX) XL Hi-Rider 4-door utility (2015-11-11) 02.jpg|Rear '''First post-facelift styling''' File:2017 Ford Ranger Limited.jpg|Front File:2015-2018 Ford Ranger (PX) XLT 4WD 4-door utility (2018-07-19) 02.jpg|Rear == Trim levels == The global Ranger T6 follows traditional Ford truck trim level nomenclature, offering XL, XLS, and XLT trim levels. Based on its four-wheel drive versions, Ford offers the Ford Ranger FX4 and the Ford Ranger Wildtrak, with model-specific exteriors. The North American version of the Ranger T6 shares the same nomenclature, with XL, XLT, and Lariat; the FX4 is offered as an option package for 4x4 vehicles. === Wildtrak === In certain global markets, including Australia, Ford released the Ford Ranger Wildtrak as a special edition of the Ranger. Based on the four-wheel drive crew-cab, the Wildtrak was equipped with a 3.2L Duratorq diesel engine with a manual or automatic transmission. To visually distinguish the model, the Wildtrak was equipped with a model-specific grille (painted dark grey), model-specific 18-inch wheels, and other exterior and interior trim. Marketed in a colour exclusive to the trim (Pride Orange), the Wildtrak was also offered in several other colours. File:2014 Ford Ranger (PX) Wildtrak 4WD 4-door utility (2015-07-03) 01.jpg|2014 Ranger Wildtrak File:2014 Ford Ranger (PX) Wildtrak 4WD 4-door utility (2015-07-03) 02.jpg|2014 Ranger Wildtrak File:2017 Ford Ranger Wildtrak 4X4 facelift 3.2 Front.jpg|2017 Ranger Wildtrak File:2017 Ford Ranger Wildtrak 4X4 facelift 3.2 Rear.jpg|2017 Ranger Wildtrak === Raptor === [[File:Ford Ranger Raptor at IAA 2019 IMG 0548.jpg|thumb|Ford Ranger Raptor display in Frankfurt, Germany.]] Unveiled by Ford in Thailand in 2018, the Ford Ranger Raptor is an 2019 production model.https://paultan.org/2018/02/12/first-look-2018-ford-ranger-raptor-in-thailand/ Similar to the larger F-150 Raptor, the Ranger Raptor is a high-performance truck optimized for off-road driving. Marking the debut of the 210hp 2.0L [[EcoBlue]] bi-turbo diesel engine in the Ranger paired to a 10-speed automatic transmission, the Raptor is equipped with standard four-wheel drive and upgraded chassis and suspension. As with the F-150 Raptor, the grille of the Ranger Raptor replaces the Ford Blue Oval with "FORD" in block letters. In October 2018, Ford confirmed that the Ranger Raptor would not be available in North America, citing that the Ranger Raptor is designed specifically for markets where the F-150 Raptor is not available; Ford also noted that demand for the F-150 Raptor in the U.S. outpaces supply.{{cite web|url=https://www.cnet.com/roadshow/news/ford-ranger-raptor-not-for-us/|title=Ford Ranger Raptor remains a no-go in the US|last1=Krok|first1=Andrew|publisher=Road Show by CNET|accessdate=20 October 2018}} [[File:Ford Ranger Raptor at IAA 2019 IMG 0549.jpg|thumb|Rear view]]

Along with dual front and side airbags, the Ranger is equipped with curtain airbags; European versions are equipped with a driver-side knee airbag. Along with standard anti-lock brakes, the Ranger is equipped with [[emergency brake assist]]. The twin-piston {{convert|302|mm|in|1|abbr=on|order=flip}} by {{convert|32|mm|in|1|abbr=on|order=flip}} front brake rotors are joined by {{convert|270|mm|in|1|abbr=on|order=flip}} by {{convert|55|mm|in|1|abbr=on|order=flip}} rear drums (on two-wheel drive Rangers) and {{convert|295|mm|in|1|abbr=on|order=flip}} by {{convert|55|mm|in|1|abbr=on|order=flip}} rear drums (on Hi-Rider and all 4x4 Rangers). Australia XLT and WildTrak variants have the optional Tech Pack for $800. This includes Adaptive Cruise Control, Lane Keeping Aid, Lane Departure Warning, Automatic High Beams, Front windscreen mounted camera and a radar placed on in the front right side of the grille. ==Variants== === Ford Everest === {{main|Ford Everest}} Ford revealed the concept for the next-generation Ford Everest in August 2013. The Everest SUV features [[Ford Kinetic Design|Kinetic Design]] cues similar to the [[Ford EcoSport|EcoSport]], [[Ford Kuga|Kuga]]/[[Ford Escape|Escape]], and [[Ford Edge|Edge]].{{cite web|last=Vijayenthiran|first=Viknesh|title=2015 Ford Edge Previewed By 2013 L.A. Auto Show Concept|url=http://www.motorauthority.com/news/1088603_2015-ford-edge-previewed-by-2013-l-a-auto-show-concept|publisher=Motor Authority|accessdate=20 November 2013}} The vehicle is offered in both rear-wheel drive and four-wheel drive, mated either to the 2.2-L or 3.2-L Duratorq, depending on the market. A minor facelift in 2018 provided a refreshed front, a new 2.0 bi-turbo diesel from the Ranger Raptor, Autonomous Emergency Braking, and a 10-speed auto with the 2.0. Presently, no plans exist to offer the Everest outside of the Asia-Pacific and South African markets; in North America, the Everest overlaps with the [[Ford Explorer|Explorer]], [[Ford Expedition|Expedition]], and [[Ford Flex|Flex]] in size and cost as well as seating, cargo, and towing capacity.{{cite web|last=Glon|first=Ronan|title=Ford previews Australia-bound Everest SUV|url=http://www.leftlanenews.com/ford-everest.html|work=Left Lane News|accessdate=5 September 2013}}{{cite web|last=Turkus|first=Brandon|title=Ford Australia debuts Ranger-based Everest SUV concept|url=http://www.autoblog.com/2013/08/13/ford-australia-debuts-ranger-based-everest-suv-concept/|work=AutoBlog|accessdate=5 September 2013}} However, in the Philippines, the Everest is sold alongside the Explorer and Expedition Max.{{cite web|title=Ford Philippines--SUVs|url=http://www.ford.com.ph/suv|publisher=Ford Philippines|accessdate=27 October 2015}} In China, the Ford Everest is manufactured by [[Jiangling Motors]], at Jiangling's [[Nanchang]] factory.{{cite web|title=JMC manufacturers the Ford Everest for the Chinese market|url=http://chinaautoweb.com/2015/08/jiangling-ford-starts-rolling-out-the-everest-suv-in-nanchang/|work=Chinaautoweb.com|accessdate=22 November 2015}} In India, Ford markets the Everest as the Ford Endeavour. A military version is marketed as the Arquus Trapper. The Ford Everest is used as the base for the French VT4, the successor of the old PT4, based on a Mercedes chassis. File:2015 Ford Everest Titanium (New Zealand).jpg|Ford Everest Trend File:Wikimania 2018, Cape Town (P1050766).jpg|Ford Everest Trend === Ford Bronco (2021) === {{main|Ford_Bronco#Sixth_generation_(2020,_to_commence)|l1=Ford Bronco (sixth generation)}} Alongside the North American revival of the Ford Ranger, Ford is reintroducing the Ford Bronco SUV.[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=tk6iShyuM3M Ford NAIAS 2017: Official Press Conference Livestream] Scheduled for the 2021 model year,[http://www.detroitnews.com/story/business/autos/ford/2015/08/25/ford-ranger/32373741/ "Ford plans to build Ranger at Michigan Assembly"] from [[Detroit News]] (August 25, 2015) the Bronco will be a mid-size SUV based on the Ranger and slotted below the standard-length Expedition and above the Explorer in the Ford model line. While mechanically derived from the Ranger T6, Ford chief technical officer Raj Nair stated that the 2021 Bronco would be its own unique vehicle and would not be an adaptation of the existing Ford Everest SUV.{{cite web|url=http://www.carscoops.com/2017/01/ford-boss-raj-nair-says-new-bronco-will.html|title=Ford Boss Raj Nair Says New Bronco Will Be ‘Completely Unique’ From Everest, But Will Share Chassis|last1=Halas|first1=John|publisher=Carscoops|accessdate=14 January 2017}} === JMC Yuhu === [[File:JMC Yuhu China 2017-03-22.jpg|thumb|JMC Yuhu]] {{main|JMC Yuhu}} [[Jiangling Motors]] (the automotive joint-venture affiliate of Ford in China) has assembled the [[JMC Yuhu]] since August 2015.{{cite web|url=http://www.chinaautoweb.com/2015/08/jiangling-ford-starts-rolling-out-the-everest-suv-in-nanchang/|title=Jiangling Ford Starts Rolling Out the Everest SUV in Nanchang|date=19 August 2015|work=Chinaautoweb.com|accessdate=21 August 2015}} A mid-size pickup based upon a proprietary platform, the exterior of the Yuhu is derived loosely upon both the Ranger and the Mazda BT-50. === Mazda BT-50 === {{main|Mazda BT-50}} Developed in tandem with the Ford Ranger T6, the [[Mazda BT-50#Second generation (UP; 2011–2015)|Mazda BT-50]] is mechanically identical to the Ranger, using the 2.2L and 3.2L Duratorq diesels (as the rebranded MZ-CD engines). In the reverse of Mazda truck tradition in global markets, the second-generation BT-50 was developed by Ford. As the BT-50 was styled using the work of a separate design team, the two vehicles share almost no common body panels, with the exception of the roof stamping and the window glass. While the global Ford Ranger is entering production for the United States and Canada for the 2019 model year, Mazda North America has no current plans to market any version of the Mazda BT-50 in North America. File:2013 Mazda BT-50 (UP) XTR 4WD 4-door utility (2015-07-24) 01.jpg|2013 Mazda BT-50 4WD 4-door File:2013 Mazda BT-50 (UP) XTR 4WD 4-door utility (2015-07-24) 02.jpg|2013 Mazda BT-50 4WD 4-door === Troller T4 === [[File:Troller.jpg|thumb|Troller T4 (pre-redesign)]] The [[Troller T4]] is an [[off-road vehicle]] produced in Brazil by Ford subsidiary [[Troller Veículos Especiais S/A]] that has been produced since 2004. Using a similar body and chassis configuration as the [[Jeep Wrangler]] and [[Land Rover Defender|Land Rover]], in 2014, Troller modernized the T4, replacing the entire chassis with a version of the Ranger frame shortened to fit the T4 body. {{Clear}} == North American production (2019–present) == {{Main|Ford Ranger (fourth generation)}} [[File:2020 Ford Ranger.jpg|thumb|2020 Ford Ranger SuperCrew XLT]] For its 2011 launch, the Ford Ranger T6 replaced previous generations of the Ranger worldwide, consolidating designs developed by Ford and Mazda. A notable exception included the United States and Canada, as Ford exited the compact truck segment entirely. During the early 2010s, Ford concentrated its light truck design resources in North America on its F-Series trucks, with its [[Ford F-Series (thirteenth generation)|2015 redesign]] including an aluminum-intensive body and introducing direct-injection and turbocharged engines in an effort to improve fuel economy. Outside of North America, the F-Series trucks were not as widely marketed as the Ranger (excepting Mexico, the Caribbean, and the Middle East[http://www.me.ford.com/en/are/all-vehicles Ford Middle East All Vehicles (English)][http://www.ford.mx/camiones Ford Mexico Trucks (Spanish)]); along with their larger size and taxes on engine displacement, in global markets, the F-Series were met with a lack of diesel engines (F-150) and factory [[Right- and left-hand traffic|right-hand drive]] capability.{{cite web|url=http://www.autoblog.com/2010/09/20/u-s-spec-ford-ranger-to-officially-end-production-in-2011-ford/|title=U.S.-spec Ford Ranger to officially end production in 2011, Ford explains why|last=Bowman|first=Zach|publisher=Autoblog|accessdate=7 August 2011}} After an eight-year market hiatus, Ford introduced the [[Ford Ranger (fourth generation)|fourth generation-Ranger]] for North America for 2019.https://media.ford.com/content/fordmedia/fna/us/en/news/2018/01/14/an-american-favorite-reinvented--new-ford-ranger-brings-built-fo.html The first mid-size Ranger sold in North America, the Ranger T6 underwent several design modifications to accommodate US crash standards (and increase its payload), with the 2019 Ranger receiving fully-boxed frame rails. Externally, the front fascia was restyled to allow for a separate steel front bumper. All fourth-generation Rangers are built on the Hi-Rider chassis; SuperCab (2+2 doors) and SuperCrew (4 doors) configurations are sold. Exclusive to North American production, the Ranger is powered by a 270hp 2.3L EcoBoost inline-4, paired with a 10-speed automatic transmission.{{Clear}} == Sales == {| class=wikitable style="text-align: right;" |- ! The smallest American Ford vehicle since 1907, the Pinto was the first subcompact vehicle produced by Ford in North America. The Pinto was marketed in three body styles through its production: a two-door fastback sedan with a trunk, a three-door hatchback, and a two-door station wagon. [[Mercury (automobile)|Mercury]] offered rebadged versions of the Pinto as the '''Mercury Bobcat''' from 1975 to 1980 (1974–1980 in CanadaMays, James C. ''Ford and Canada: 100 Years Together'' (Montréal: Syam Publishing, 2003). p.116.). From 1974 to 1978, the [[Ford Mustang (second generation)|Ford Mustang II]] shared a common platform with the Pinto and Bobcat, though with a different unibody and powertrain assortment. For the 1981 model year, the Pinto was replaced by the [[Ford Escort (North America)|Ford Escort]], as Ford moved its product line towards front-wheel drive. Over 3 million Pintos were produced over its 10-year production run, outproducing the combined totals of its domestic rivals, the Chevy Vega and the AMC Gremlin. The Pinto and Mercury Bobcat were produced at [[Edison Assembly]] 1n Edison, New Jersey, [[St. Thomas Assembly]] in Southwold, Ontario, and [[San Jose Assembly Plant|San Jose Assembly]] in Milpitas, California.{{cite news|url=http://sfgate.com/cgi-bin/article.cgi?f=/c/a/2006/03/25/HOG2UHS4701.DTL|title=Lofty ambition / Developer revs up former Ford factory in Richmond for real live-work spaces|last=Smith|first=Charles|date=March 25, 2006|work=The San Francisco Chronicle}} Since the 1970s, the safety reputation of the Pinto has been surrounded by controversy. Its fuel-tank design attracted both media and government scrutiny after several deadly fires related to the tanks rupturing in rear-end collisions. A subsequent analysis of the overall safety of the Pinto suggested it was comparable to other 1970s subcompact cars. The safety issues surrounding the Pinto and the subsequent response by Ford have been cited widely as a [[business ethics]] as well as [[tort reform]] case study. ==Background== [[File:Gremlin-Pinto-Vega in 2010.JPG|thumb|left|First-generation American subcompacts, left to right: AMC Gremlin, Ford Pinto, Chevrolet Vega]] American automakers had first countered imports such as the [[Volkswagen Beetle]] with vehicles [[compact car]]s including the [[Ford Falcon (North America)|Ford Falcon]], [[Ford Maverick (Americas)|Ford Maverick]], [[Chevrolet Corvair]] and [[Plymouth Valiant]], although these cars featured six-cylinder engines and comprised a larger vehicle class. As the popularity of smaller Japanese imports from [[Toyota]] and [[Datsun]] increased throughout the 1960s, Ford North America responded by introducing the [[Ford Cortina|Cortina]] from [[Ford of Europe]] as a [[captive import]]. American automakers soon introduced their own subcompacts,{{cite web|last1=SHEREFKIN|first1=ROBERT|title=Ford 100: Defective Pinto almost took Ford's reputation with it Read more: http://autoweek.com/article/car-news/ford-100-defective-pinto-almost-took-fords-reputation-it#ixzz4wdHFnN3Y|url=http://autoweek.com/article/car-news/ford-100-defective-pinto-almost-took-fords-reputation-it|website=Autoweek|accessdate=October 26, 2017|date=June 17, 2003}} led by the [[AMC Gremlin]], which arrived six months before the Pinto, and the [[Chevrolet Vega]], introduced the day before the Pinto. Named for the [[Pinto horse|pony]],{{cite web|title=Why Ford keeps using horse names for cars|url=https://www.jenningsforddirect.co.uk/car-guides/history-of-ford-cars/why-ford-keeps-using-horse-names-for-cars/5099/|publisher=Jennings Ford Direct|accessdate=October 26, 2017}} the Pinto was introduced on September 11, 1970. It was a completely new platform, but utilized a powertrain from the European-specification [[Ford Escort (Europe)|Escort]]. Ford Chairman [[Henry Ford II]] himself purchased a 1971 Runabout (hatchback) to use as one of his personal cars.{{harvnb|Lewis|2003}} pages 262–231 == Product development == [[File:Ford Pinto at Studio 1970 (3597548009).jpg|left|thumb|Ford Pinto design proposal, 1970]] Initial planning for the Pinto began in the summer of 1967, was recommended by Ford's Product Planning Committee in December 1968, and was approved by Ford's Board of Directors in January 1969.{{harvnb|Danley|2005}}: Initial planning on the Pinto, a second-generation subcompact, began in 1967 ... In January 1969, in a victory for Iaccoca, Ford's Board approved the recommendation of the Product Planning Committee (December 1968) to produce the Pinto. Ford President [[Lee Iacocca]] wanted a 1971 model that weighed under 2,000 pounds and that would be priced at less than [[US$]]2,000. The Pinto product development, from conception through delivery, was completed in 25 months, when the automotive industry average was 43 months, the shortest production planning schedule in automotive history at the time. Some development processes usually conducted sequentially were conducted in parallel. [[Machine tooling]] overlapped with product development, which froze the basic design. Decisions which threatened the schedule were discouraged;{{harvnb|Gioia|1992}}: The Pinto was brought from inception to production in the record time of approximately 25 months (compared to the industry average of 43 months), a time frame that suggested the necessity for doing things expediently. In addition to the time pressure, the engineering and development teams were required to adhere to the production "limits of 2000" for the diminutive car: it was not to exceed either $2000 in cost or 2000 pounds in weight. Any decisions that threatened these targets or the timing of the car's introduction were discouraged. Under normal conditions design, styling, product planning, engineering, etc., were completed prior to production tooling. Because of the foreshortened time frame, however, some of these usually sequential processes were executed in parallel. As a consequence, tooling was already well under way (thus "freezing" the basic design) ...{{cite journal |last1=Helms |first1=Marilyn M. |last2=Hutchins |first2=Betty A. |year=1992 |title=Poor quality products: Is their production unethical? |journal=Management Decision |volume=30 |issue=5 |page=35 |quote=When a decision was made to produce the Pinto, it was given the shortest production planning schedule in history. Tooling went on at the same time as product development so, when testing revealed a serious defect with the gas tank, the $200 million Pinto tooling machines were almost completely built. The directive came from the top, President Lee Iacocca, who emphasized that the Pinto was not to weigh an ounce over 2,000lb and not cost a cent over $2,000 and that safety was not a priority, because "safety doesn't sell". |doi=10.1108/00251749210015661}}{{harvnb|Wojdyla|2011}}: The genesis of the Ford Pinto came sometime in 1968, when Ford's then-president Lee Iaccoca decided that his company would not sit idly by as new Japanese competitors dominated the small-car segment. He pushed the board to greenlight the Pinto program, and by August 1968 the program was underway. It would have aggressive targets: no more than 2000 pounds, not a penny over $2000 and a delivery deadline of just 25 months, a record at the time and still impressive today. the attitude of Ford management was to develop the Pinto as quickly as possible.{{harvnb|Wojdyla|2011}}: But at the time, management's attitude was to get the product out the door as fast as possible. Iacocca ordered a rush project to build the car, and the Pinto became known internally as "Lee's car".{{harvnb|Sherefkin|2003|}}: Iacocca ordered a rush program to build the Pinto ... The Pinto quickly became known as "Lee's car." He demanded that it weigh no more than 2,000 pounds and sell for $2,000 ... Iacocca was in a hurry. He wanted the car in showrooms for the 1971 model year. That meant one of the shortest production planning periods in modern automotive history: just 25 months, when the normal time span was 43 months. That also meant that the Pinto's tooling was developed at the same time as product development. The Pinto's bodywork was styled by Robert Eidschun. Offered with an [[inline-4]] engine and [[bucket seats]] the Pinto's mechanical design was conventional, with [[unibody]] construction, a longitudinally mounted engine in front driving the rear wheels through either a [[manual transmission|manual]] or [[automatic transmission]] and [[live axle]] rear end. Suspension was by unequal-length [[control arm]]s with front [[coil spring]]s; the live rear axle was suspended on [[leaf spring]]s. The rack and pinion steering optionally had [[Power steering|power assist]], as did the brakes.{{cite news|title=Pinto 2000 Coupe|url=http://pintopage.fordpinto.com/Pinto%202000%20Coupe.htm|accessdate=April 29, 2016|agency=Super Stock Magazine|date=December 1970}} ==Production history== On September 11, 1970, Ford introduced the Pinto under the tagline ''The Little Carefree Car.''{{cite news |url=https://news.google.com/newspapers?id=HJNYAAAAIBAJ&sjid=RPgDAAAAIBAJ&pg=5900%2C2733608 |work=Spokane Daily Chronicle |location=(Washington) |agency=(advertisement) |title=Meet Ford's new Pinto. The little carefree car. |date=September 10, 1970 |page=12 }}{{cite news |newspaper=Milwaukee Sentinel |agency=(advertisement) |date=September 18, 1970 |page=9, part 1 |url=https://news.google.com/newspapers?id=IKRRAAAAIBAJ&sjid=vhAEAAAAIBAJ&pg=4421%2C3398540 |title=The Little Carefree Car}} After structural design on alternate body styles encountered obstacles, Ford offered the Pinto solely as a two-door sedan, with entry level models priced at $1,850, undercutting GM's [[Chevrolet Vega]] and directly targeting imported models – which included such new competitors as the [[Mazda Familia|Mazda 1200]] in 1971, the [[Subaru Leone|Subaru DL]] in 1972, and the [[Honda Civic (first generation)|Honda Civic]] in 1973.{{cite magazine|authorlink=Karl Ludvigsen (Charles Bulmer -Ed)|title = Quart in a Pinto|magazine=[[The Motor (magazine)|The Motor]]|volume=3558|pages=26–27|date=August 26, 1970}} The Pinto had sold over 100,000 units by January 1971,{{cite web|url=http://auto.howstuffworks.com/1971-1980-ford-pinto3.htm|title=1971-1980 Ford Pinto|publisher= HowStuffWorks.com|date=2007-08-09}} and 352,402 for the entire 1971 production run; 1974 saw the most Pintos produced in a single model year, with 544,209 units.''Standard Catalog of Ford'', 4th edition, 2007, by John Gunnell. Krause Publications ===1971–1973=== [[File:Ford Pinto (1910839183).jpg|left|thumb|1971–1972 Ford Pinto sedan with enclosed trunk]][[File:Ford Pinto runabout (1).jpg|thumb|1973 Pinto Runabout,
noting view of rear hatch]] The Ford Pinto went on sale on September 11, 1970 in one body style, a fastback sedan with an enclosed trunk. A hatchback became available on February 20, 1971, debuting at the [[Chicago Auto Show]].{{cite web|title = Birth of the Ford Pinto | publisher = Howstuffworks.com | url = http://auto.howstuffworks.com/1971-1980-ford-pinto.htm/printable| date = 2007-08-09 }} In 1971, the Pinto brochure came with a paper cutout Pinto that one could fold to make a 3D model. Marketed as the ''Runabout,'' the hatchback went on sale five days later, priced at $2,062. The hatch itself featured exposed chrome hinges for the liftgate and five decorative chrome strips, pneumatic struts to assist in opening the hatch, a rear window approximately as large as the sedan's, and a fold-down seat – a feature which became simultaneously an option on the sedan. The hatchback model matched the sedan in all other dimensions and offered {{convert|38.1|cuft|m3}} of cargo space with its seat folded. By 1972, Ford redesigned the hatch itself, with the glass portion of the hatch enlarged to almost the entire size of the hatch itself, ultimately to be supplemented for 1977–1980 with an optional rear hatch that was entirely glass.{{Cite web|url=https://i.pinimg.com/736x/40/f2/60/40f2609e7d16248e91a8a72ae8715d90--ford-pinto-ford-maverick.jpg|title=1980 Ford Pinto Brochure|last=|first=|date=|website=|access-date=}} On October 30, 1970, less than two months after introduction, 26,000 Pintos were recalled to address a possible problem with the accelerator sticking on once engaged at more than halfway.{{harvnb|Jones|1978}}: Soon after the Pinto was introduced, 26,000 were recalled because accelerators were sticking.{{cite news |title=Ford Recalls 26,000 Pinto Cars |newspaper=[[Chicago Tribune]] |date=October 31, 1970 |url=http://archives.chicagotribune.com/1970/10/31/page/10/article/ford-recalls-26-000-pinto-cars |accessdate=March 6, 2016 |quote=Ford Motor Co. announced today it is recalling 26,000 early production models of its 1971 Pinto equipped with the 1600 cubic centimeter engine because of an accelerator problem ... The company found that when the throttle is opened more than half way, it is possible that it may not always return to the closed position when pressure on the accelerator pedal is removed}}{{harvnb|Associated Press|1971}}: For many of the motorists, it's the second time around ... Last October Ford recalled some 26,000 Pintos because of complaints about accelerator pedals sticking when the throttle was opened more than halfway. On March 29, 1971, Ford recalled all 220,000 Pintos manufactured before March 19, 1971, to address a problem with fuel vapors in the engine air filter possibly igniting by a backfire through the [[carburetor]].{{harvnb|Jones|1978}}: 220,000 Pintos were recalled for modifications to prevent possible engine compartment fires.{{cite news |last=Mateja |first=James |title=Ford Recalls 204,000 Pintos to Prevent Fuel Vapor Fires |date=March 30, 1971 |newspaper=[[Chicago Tribune]] |quote=Ford Motor Co. will recall about 204,000 subcompact 1971 Pintos for modification to prevent possible ignition of fuel vapors in the engine air cleaner, it announced yesterday. A Ford Spokesman declined to give the cost of the recall, but all Pintos produced thru March 19, including 204,000 in the United States, 13,000 in Canada and 2,500 overseas, are involved in the program ... Ford said its investigation of complaints revealed that the possibility of a fire existed because the vapors in the air cleaner could be ignited by a backfire thru the carburetor.}}{{harvnb|Associated Press|1971}}: About 165,000 American owners of Ford's new Pinto are affected by the automaker's announcement that virtually all the mini-cars are being recalled for an engine defect. On February 24, 1972, the Pinto station wagon debuted with an overall length of {{convert|172.7|in|mm|abbr=on}} and {{convert|60.5|cuft|m3}} of cargo volume. The first 2-door Ford station wagon since the 1965 Falcon, the Pinto wagon was equipped with flip-open rear quarter windows. Along with front disc brakes, the 2.0L engine was standard equipment. A ''Pinto Squire'' wagon featured faux wood side paneling similar to the full-size [[Ford Country Squire|Country Squire]].http://oldcarbrochures.org/index.php/New-Brochures---May/1972-Ford-Pinto-Brochure-Rev/1972-Ford-Pinto-Rev--08-09{{cite web|title=1972 Ford (USA) Pinto Station Wagon|url=http://www.automobile-catalog.com/make/ford_usa/pinto/pinto_station_wagon/1972.html|publisher=automobile-catalog.com|accessdate=October 26, 2017 |editor=Pawel Zal}} Also in February 1972, the Sprint Decor Group was made available for the Pinto for one model year only. The Sprint Decor Group included white exterior paint with blue accent paint and red pin-striping, a blacked out grille, color-keyed wheels with bright trim rings and hubcaps, white sidewall tires and color-keyed dual sport mirrors. The interior included red, white and blue cloth and vinyl bucket seats, full carpeting and a deluxe steering wheel. The Sprint Decor Group was offered simultaneously on the Maverick and Mustang.{{Cite web|url=http://pintopage.fordpinto.com/72%20Pinto%20Sprint%20Package.htm|title=1972 Ford Pinto Sprint|access-date=January 3, 2018}} For the 1973 model year, more appearance options were offered. There was a new Sport Accent Group offered in white exterior paint with a choice of two-tone orange or avocado accent paint, matching vinyl roof and a deluxe interior with wood-tone trim. There was also a new Luxury Decor Group with bright exterior dress up mouldings, black bumper rub strips and deluxe interior with wood-tone trim. New slotted forged aluminum wheels were offered.{{Cite web|url=http://www.oldcarbrochures.com/static/NA/Ford/1973_Ford/1973%20Ford%20Pinto%20Brochure/index1.html|title=1973 Ford Pinto Brochure|access-date=January 3, 2018}} ===1974–1978=== [[File:1974 Ford Pinto two-door wagon, rear left.jpg|left|thumb|1974 Ford Pinto station wagon]] In 1974, to meet federal regulations, [[5 mph bumper]]s were added to both the front and rear. Unlike most 1970s cars, the addition of larger bumpers to the Pinto did not necessitate major changes to the bodywork. While the underpowered Kent engine was dropped, the optional OHC engine was expanded to 2.3L; in various forms this engine powered a variety of Ford vehicles for 23 years. In 1974, Mercury began selling a rebadged version of the Pinto called Bobcat as a Canada-only model. 544,209 units sold; 1974 became the most popular model year for the Pinto. Steel-belted tires, an anti-theft alarm system, and metallic glow paint were optional.http://oldcarbrochures.org/index.php/New-Brochures---March/1974-Ford-Pinto-Brochure-Rev/1974-Ford-Pinto-Rev--10-11 In 1975, in a move to better compete with the AMC Gremlin, Ford introduced the 2.8L V6; while far less powerful than the Gremlin, the V6 gave the Pinto a feature unavailable in the Chevrolet Vega. Sales of the Mercury Bobcat were expanded to Lincoln-Mercury dealers in the United States; it was sold as a hatchback and station wagon.{{harvnb|Lewis|2003}} pages 286-290 [[File:1976 Ford Pinto (9912822385).jpg|thumb|1976 Ford Pinto Runabout]] As a minor styling update for 1976, the Pinto received the egg-crate grille and chrome headlamp bezels recycled from the Canada-only 1974 Mercury Bobcat. For one model year only, two new option packages were offered. One was the sporty new Stallion appearance package with black out trim and black two-tone accent paint offered in red, yellow, silver and white body colors. This option package was shared with the Mustang II and Maverick. The other new option package was the Runabout Squire which featured wood-grain vinyl bodysides like the Squire wagon. The interior received the optional Luxury Decor Group which featured new low back vinyl or plaid cloth bucket seats with matching door trim.{{Cite web|url=http://paintref.com/cgi-bin/brochuredisplay.cgi?year=1976&manuf=Ford&model=Pinto&smod=&page=1&scan=1|title=1976 Ford Pinto Brochure|last=|first=|date=|website=Paintref.com|access-date=}} [[File:1978 Ford Pinto hatchback at 2015 Rockville Show 2of5.jpg|thumb|1977–1978 Ford Pinto Runabout]] [[File:Turbo Pinto (14430994634).jpg|thumb|1977–1978 Ford Pinto Runabout with optional all glass hatch]] For the 1977 model year, the Pinto received its first significant styling updates with slanted back urethane headlamp buckets, parking lamps and grille. The tail-lamps were revised except for the wagons. Runabouts offered an optional all glass rear hatch for the first time. Pinto wagons were given a new option package. Dubbed the ''Pinto Cruising Wagon'', it was the [[sedan delivery]] version of the Pinto styled to resemble a small [[conversion van]], complete with round side panel "bubble windows" and a choice of optional vinyl graphics.{{harvnb|Lewis|2003}} pages 289-303 Ford offered new sporty appearance packages similar to those found on the Chevrolet Vega and AMC Gremlin but were strictly cosmetic upgrades that added nothing to vehicle performance. [[File:1978 Ford Pinto Cruising Wagon, front left.jpg|thumb|1977–1978 Ford Pinto Cruising Wagon]] In 1978, the Pinto was no longer the smallest Ford sold in the U.S., as the company introduced the [[Ford Fiesta|Fiesta]]. Nearly two feet shorter than the Pinto, the German-designed Fiesta was the first front-wheel drive car sold by Ford in the USA.{{harvnb|Lewis|2003}} pages 304-309 ===1979–1980=== [[File:Classic Yellow Ford Pinto.jpg|left|thumb|1979–1980 Ford Pinto sedan]] [[File:'80 Ford Pinto Hatchback (Orange Julep).jpg|thumb|1979–1980 Ford Pinto Runabout]] For the 1979 model year, the Pinto saw its last significant styling update. Shedding its original Maverick-like styling, the Pinto took on the look of the modern Fairmont with rectangular headlamps, inboard vertical parking lamps and a taller slanted back grille. Except for the wagons, the tail-lamps were revised. The interior was updated with a new rectangular instrument cluster and modified dash-pad for vehicles without the optional sports instrumentation. The variety of sports appearance packages was revised, some with new graphics.{{harvnb|Lewis|2003}} pages 310-315 1980 marked the end of the Pinto's production run. For 1980, the V6 engine was discontinued, leaving the 2.3L as the sole engine.{{cite news|last1=Lamm|first1=Michael|title=PM Owners Report: Ford Pinto|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=TM8DAAAAMBAJ&lpg=PA63&dq=mercury%20bobcat%201974&pg=PA62#v=onepage&q=mercury%20bobcat%201974&f=false|work=Popular Mechanics|agency=Popular Mechanics Magazine|date=August 1974}}{{cite web|title=The Ford Pinto|url=http://pintopage.fordpinto.com/Production%20Figures.htm}} {|class="wikitable" style="text-align: center; background: white; margin:auto;" |- !width="105px"|Calendar year ! 1971 ! 1972 ! 1973 ! 1974 ! 1975 ! 1976 ! 1977 ! 1978 ! 1979 ! 1980 |- | Units | 352,402 | 480,405 | 484,512 | 544,209 | 223,763 | 290,132 | 225,097 | 188,899 | 199,018 | 185,054 |- !colspan="11" style="background:silver;"|Total production 3,173,491 |} {{Clear}} ==Powertrain== Except for 1980, the Pinto was available with a choice of two engines. For the first five years of production, only four-cylinder inline engines were offered. Ford changed the power ratings almost every year.{{cite book|author1=Gunnell, John A. |author2=Lenzke, James T.|year=1995|title=Standard Catalog of Ford Cars, 1903–1990|publisher=Krause Publications|isbn=0-87341-140-4}} In 1974, the {{convert|2.3|l|cuin}} ''[[Ford Pinto engine#2.3 OHC|OHC]]'' I4 engine was introduced. This engine was updated and modified several times, allowing it to remain in production into 1997. Among other Ford vehicles, a turbocharged version of this engine later powered the performance-based [[Ford Thunderbird#Ninth generation (1983–1988)|Thunderbird Turbo Coupe]], [[Ford Mustang SVO|Mustang SVO]], and the European-built [[Merkur XR4Ti]]. Initial Pinto deliveries in the early years used the English {{convert|1600|cc|cuin|abbr=on}} and German {{convert|2000|cc|cuin|abbr=on}} engines tuned for performance (see below). The 2,000 cc engine used a two-barrel carburetor where just one bore was bigger than that used on the Maverick. With the low weight (not much above {{convert|2000|lb|kg|abbr=on}}) and the SOHC engine it accelerated from 0 to 60mph in 10.8 seconds. With the advent of emission control requirements, Ford moved from European-sourced to domestically-sourced engines, using new or modified designs. New safety legislation affected bumpers and other parts, adding to the weight of the car and reducing performance. [[Horsepower#Society of Automotive Engineers|Revised SAE standards]] in 1972 dropped the Pinto's {{convert|1.6|l|cuin|abbr=on}} engine to {{convert|54|bhp|kW|abbr=on}} – and the {{convert|2.0|l|cuin|abbr=on}} engine to {{convert|86|hp|kW|abbr=on}}.{{cite web|url=http://auto.howstuffworks.com/1971-1980-ford-pinto.htm|title=HowStuffWorks "The Birth of the Ford Pinto"|author1=THE AUTO EDITORS OF CONSUMER GUIDE|publisher=How Stuff Works|date=2007-08-09}} {| class="wikitable" border="1" |- !
