===Recall=== In March 2017, Ford recalled 692,700 2014 Escapes because of faulty door latches.{{cite news|last1=Krisher|first1=Tom|title=Ford recalls 570,000 vehicles for engine fire risk, door latch trouble|url=https://www.theglobeandmail.com/report-on-business/ford-recalls-570000-vehicles-for-engine-fire-risk-door-latch-trouble/article34471584/|accessdate=1 April 2017|work=The Globe and Mail|agency=AP|date=29 Mar 2017}} ===Fire hazard=== =====Ford Escape: North America===== In December 2012, Ford recalled over 70,000 Escapes in the United States and Canada with 1.6 litre engines that may overheat and cause fires, after twelve reports of fire in Escapes were reported to Ford.{{cite web|title=Ford recalls 2013 Escape, Fusion: Potential fires in 89,000 cars with 1.6-liter engine|url=http://autoweek.com/article/car-news/ford-recalls-2013-escape-fusion-potential-fires-89000-cars-16-liter-engine|website=Autoweek|accessdate=1 April 2017}} In November 2013, Ford recalled over 160,000 Escapes with 1.6 EcoBoost engines because of oil and fuel leaks that could lead to engine fires, after 13 fires caused by leaks were reported to Ford; the recall also covered about 12,000 to correct fuel lines installed incorrectly that could become chafed and leak gas.{{cite news|last1=Krisher|first1=Tom|title=Ford recalls hot-selling Escape SUV for seventh time after oil and gas leaks linked to 13 fires|url=http://business.financialpost.com/news/transportation/ford-escape-recall|accessdate=1 April 2017|work=The Financial Post|agency=AP|date=27 Nov 2013}} In March 2017, Ford recalled 2014 Escapes with 1.6 EcoBoost engines because of a risk of engine fires caused by a “lack of coolant circulation”. The recall partly contributed to a charge of US$300 million by Ford.{{cite news|last1=Lynch|first1=Jim|title=Ford recalls 230,000 cars over potential engine fires|url=http://www.detroitnews.com/story/business/autos/ford/2017/03/29/ford-recall/99771750/|accessdate=1 April 2017|work=The Detroit News|date=29 Mar 2017}}{{cite news|title=Ford recalls 440,000 vehicles for fire risk, door latch trouble|url=http://www.cbc.ca/news/business/ford-recalls-1.4045491|accessdate=1 April 2017|agency=AP|publisher=CBC|date=29 Mar 2017}} ===== South Africa ===== In [[South Africa]], onwards from 2015, numerous Ford Kugas of the 1.6 litre EcoBoost variant caught fire.{{cite web |author= |title=Ford Kuga owner leaps from burning vehicle in Durban |work=Herald Live |url=http://www.heraldlive.co.za/news/2016/12/19/ford-kuga-owner-leaps-burning-vehicle-durban/ |publisher=The Herald (Times Media Group) |location=Port Elizabeth |date=19 December 2016 |accessdate=4 January 2017}}{{cite web |first=Sihle |last=Manda |title=Pretoria man falls prey to Kuga fire fiasco |work=IOL (Pretoria News) |url=http://www.iol.co.za/motoring/industry-news/pretoria-man-falls-prey-to-kuga-fire-fiasco-7261632 |publisher=Independent Media |location=Johannesburg |date=22 December 2016 |accessdate=4 January 2017}}{{cite web |first=Sihle |last=Manda |title=Three more Ford Kugas burst into flames |work=IOL (The Mercury) |url=http://www.iol.co.za/motoring/industry-news/three-more-ford-kugas-burst-into-flames-7317051 |publisher=Independent Media |location=Johannesburg |date=3 January 2017 |accessdate=4 January 2017}} In December 2016, Ford South Africa requested that all local Kuga owners take their vehicles in for a safety inspection.{{cite web |author= |title=Ford to inspect every Kuga sold for safety - Consumer Commission |work=Times Live |url=http://www.timeslive.co.za/local/2016/12/20/Ford-to-inspect-every-Kuga-sold-for-safety-Consumer-Commission |publisher=Times Media Group |location=Johannesburg |date=20 December 2016 |accessdate=4 January 2017}} However, even after one owner took her vehicle to a dealership, whose mechanics checked it and assured the owner that the vehicle was safe, the car still caught fire the very next day.{{cite web |first=Guy |last=Rogers |title=Close call for family in PE Kuga fire drama |work=Herald Live |url=http://www.heraldlive.co.za/news/2017/01/03/close-call-family-pe-kuga-fire-drama/ |publisher=The Herald (Times Media Group) |location=Port Elizabeth |date=3 January 2017 |accessdate=4 January 2017}} Another owner was assured by a dealership that his vehicle would be safe as long as the coolant level was correct, but his Kuga burned a few days later.{{cite web |first=Amanda |last=Maliba |title=Ford to hold media briefing as another Kuga goes up in smoke |work=IOL (Sunday Independent) |url=http://www.iol.co.za/news/ford-to-hold-media-briefing-as-another-kuga-goes-up-in-smoke-7410156 |publisher=Independent Media |location=Johannesburg |date=15 January 2017 |accessdate=17 January 2017}} One driver is reported to have died as a result of a fire in his Kuga in December 2015.{{cite web |first=Graeme |last=Hosken |title=Burnt to death in a Ford Kuga: what really happened? |work=Times Live |url=http://www.timeslive.co.za/local/2016/12/08/Burnt-to-death-in-a-Ford-Kuga-what-really-happened |publisher=Times Media Group |location=Johannesburg |date=8 December 2016 |accessdate=16 January 2017}} His vehicle allegedly exhibited several faults, but was checked by Ford and passed as safe shortly before the fire. Subsequently, there were further reports of fires and other failures occurring after safety checks at Ford facilities. As of 16 January 2017, at least 46 Kugas in South Africa had been destroyed by fire,{{cite web |first=Graeme |last=Hosken |title=Kuga catches fire on way to dealership - driver says his 'guardian angels worked overtime' |work=Times Live |url=http://www.timeslive.co.za/local/2017/01/12/WATCH-Kuga-catches-fire-on-way-to-dealership-driver-says-his-guardian-angels-worked-overtime |publisher=Times Media Group |location=Johannesburg |date=12 January 2017 |accessdate=13 January 2017}} and Ford South Africa had confirmed that a total of 39 incidents had been reported to the company. By 18 January 2017, the number of incidents had reached 50, with 13 in 2017 alone.{{cite web |first=Graeme |last=Hosken |title=Woman jumps from burning Ford Kuga outside Pretoria prison |work=Times Live |url=http://www.timeslive.co.za/local/2017/01/18/Woman-jumps-from-burning-Ford-Kuga-outside-Pretoria-prison |publisher=Times Media Group |location=Johannesburg |date=18 January 2017 |accessdate=18 January 2017}} Between November 2015 and December 2017, 72 vehicles suffered fires. By 4 February 2019, there had been more than 80 incidents, with one as recently as 1 February 2019.{{cite web |first=Malibongwe |last=Dayimani |title=Ford Kuga burns on East London expressway |work=Times Live |url=https://www.timeslive.co.za/news/south-africa/2019-02-01-ford-kuga-burns-on-east-london-expressway/ |publisher=Times Media Group |location=Johannesburg |date=1 February 2019 |accessdate=5 February 2019}} On 16 January 2017, Ford South Africa and [[South Africa]]'s National Consumer Commission (NCC){{cite web |author= |title=About the NCC |work=thencc.gov.za |url=http://www.thencc.gov.za/ |publisher=National Consumer Commission |location=Pretoria |date=2017 |accessdate=17 January 2017}} held a media briefing to announce a safety [[Product recall|recall]] of the affected Kuga model, affecting "4556 1.6 litre EcoBoost models that were built between December 2012 and February 2014".{{cite web |author=IOL Motoring Staff |title=Ford SA to finally recall fiery Kugas |work=IOL |url=http://www.iol.co.za/motoring/industry-news/ford-sa-to-finally-recall-fiery-kugas-7418489 |publisher=Independent Media |location=Johannesburg |date=16 January 2017 |accessdate=17 January 2017}}{{cite web |url=http://mg.co.za/article/2017-01-16-ford-to-begin-recall-of-kuga-vehicles |first=Ra'eesa |last=Pather |title=Combustible Kugas recall does little to extinguish criticism of SA inaction |work=Mail & Guardian Online |date=16 January 2017 |accessdate=18 January 2017 |location=Johannesburg |publisher=Mail & Guardian}} The NCC said that it had decided to exercise its authority to authorize a recall on safety grounds, and had then been informed that Ford South Africa had decided to implement a recall.{{cite web |first=Jonisayi |last=Maromo |title='No brand is bigger than the law' |work=IOL |url=http://www.iol.co.za/motoring/industry-news/no-brand-is-bigger-than-the-law-7422513 |publisher=Independent Media |location=Johannesburg |date=16 January 2017 |accessdate=17 January 2017}} Between January 2017 and January 2018, Ford implemented three safety recalls on the vehicles. Ford South Africa identified the mechanism leading to the majority of fires as overheating caused by a lack of coolant circulation, which could lead to cracking of the [[cylinder head]], resulting in an oil leak and subsequent fire in the engine compartment. The proposed solution would be first to replace and check affected components and systems, and later to improve the cooling and warning systems. As of January 2018, 6 Kugas had caught fire, or suffered engine and electronic failures, after undergoing recall. In January 2017, Ford South Africa said that it was not aware of any injuries caused by the engine fires, and claimed that the fatal incident was not the result of an engine fire.{{cite web |title=Ford insists the Jimmy Kuga fire was not an engine fire |work=SABC Digital News (YouTube channel) |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=r6ggQBR0MQA |publisher=SABC News |location=Johannesburg |date=17 January 2017 |accessdate=19 January 2017}} The causes of both the fatal fire and others are disputed.{{cite web |url=http://www.enca.com/south-africa/more-kugas-aflame |author=iNet Bridge staff |title=More Kugas aflame |work=enca.com |date=9 January 2017 |accessdate=18 January 2017 |location=Johannesburg and Cape Town |publisher=eNews Channel Africa}}{{cite web |first=Graeme |last=Hosken |title=Ford accused of ‘shopping’ for forensic reports after fatal Kuga fire |work=Times Live |url=http://www.timeslive.co.za/local/2017/01/17/Ford-accused-of-%E2%80%98shopping%E2%80%99-for-forensic-reports-after-fatal-Kuga-fire |publisher=Times Media Group |location=Johannesburg |date=17 January 2017 |accessdate=18 January 2017}} On 17 January 2017, video footage was released that allegedly recorded part of the fatal fire.{{cite web |first=Graeme |last=Hosken |title=Harrowing footage emerges of Reshall Jimmy's final moments as his Ford Kuga burns |work=Times Live |url=http://www.timeslive.co.za/local/2017/01/17/WATCH-Harrowing-footage-emerges-of-Reshall-Jimmys-final-moments-as-his-Ford-Kuga-burns |publisher=Times Media Group |location=Johannesburg |date=17 January 2017 |accessdate=18 January 2017}}{{cite web |title=EXCLUSIVE: Harrowing footage emerges of fatal Ford Kuga burning |work=Times Live (YouTube channel) |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=isV5seTpS5I |publisher=Times Media Group |location=Johannesburg |date=17 January 2017 |accessdate=18 January 2017}} In November 2018, family of the deceased owner claimed that Ford South Africa had offered them a settlement conditional on accepting that he had died from a gunshot wound.{{cite web |first=Alex |last=Mitchley |title=Ford Kuga fire saga: Sister claims Ford wanted family to say brother shot himself in exchange for R1m car |work=News24 |url=https://www.news24.com/SouthAfrica/News/ford-kuga-fire-saga-sister-claims-ford-wanted-family-to-say-brother-shot-himself-in-exchange-for-r1m-vehicle-20181121 |publisher=24.com |location=Cape Town |date=21 November 2018 |accessdate=5 February 2019}} By this time, the family was represented by [[Advocate#South Africa|Advocate]] [[Gerrie Nel]] of [[AfriForum]].{{cite web |first=Nico |last=Gous |title=AfriForum wades into family's battle with Ford over deadly Kuga fire |work=Times Live |url=https://www.timeslive.co.za/news/south-africa/2018-11-21-afriforum-wades-into-familys-battle-with-ford-over-deadly-kuga-fire/ |publisher=Times Media Group |location=Johannesburg |date=21 November 2018 |accessdate=5 February 2019}} Some owners of affected vehicles, family of the deceased owner, and other parties have criticized the conduct of Ford South Africa.{{cite web |url=http://www.iol.co.za/motoring/industry-news/ford-kuga-recall-met-with-scepticism-7441598 |first=Candice |last=Soobramoney |title=Ford Kuga recall met with scepticism |work=IOL (Post) |date=18 January 2017 |accessdate=18 January 2017 |location=Johannesburg |publisher=Independent Media}}{{cite web |url=https://businesstech.co.za/news/general/150479/consumer-commission-to-step-in-over-ford-kuga-blowout/ |author=Businesstech staff |title=Consumer commission to step in over Ford Kuga blowout |work=businesstech.co.za |date=13 January 2017 |accessdate=18 January 2017 |location=Olifantsfontein, Gauteng |publisher=MyBroadband}}{{cite web |url=http://www.iol.co.za/news/south-africa/ford-really-insensitive-says-kuga-drivers-family-7420803 |first=Jonisayi |last=Maromo |title=Ford really insensitive, says Kuga driver's family |work=IOL |date=16 January 2017 |accessdate=18 January 2017 |location=Johannesburg |publisher=Independent Media}} A commissioner of the National Consumer Commission (NCC) said that the matter should have been addressed sooner in view of the risk both to those travelling in affected Kugas, and to others. In court papers related to the fatal fire, the [[South African Police Service]] has alleged that Ford South Africa may have failed to comply with its obligations under South African [[consumer protection]] law, and obstructed the police investigation.{{cite web |first=Graeme |last=Hosken |title=Ford broke law by not informing consumer commission of Kuga death - police |work=Times Live |url=http://www.timeslive.co.za/local/2017/01/24/Ford-broke-law-by-not-informing-consumer-commission-of-Kuga-death-police |publisher=Times Media Group |location=Johannesburg |date=24 January 2017 |accessdate=24 January 2017}} On 17 January 2017, family of the deceased owner held a media briefing together with an [[Attorneys in South Africa|attorney]], and announced plans to initiate a [[class action]] lawsuit against Ford South Africa.{{cite web |url=http://www.iol.co.za/motoring/industry-news/sa-families-to-sue-ford-over-kuga-saga-7433797 |first=Jonisayi |last=Maromo |title=SA families to sue Ford over Kuga saga |work=IOL |date=17 January 2017 |accessdate=18 January 2017 |location=Johannesburg |publisher=Independent Media}}{{cite web |url=http://www.enca.com/south-africa/ill-fated-ford-kuga-was-riddled-with-faults-jimmy-family |author=Africa News Agency staff |title=Ill-fated Ford Kuga was riddled with faults: Jimmy family |work=enca.com |date=18 January 2017 |accessdate=18 January 2017 |location=Johannesburg and Cape Town |publisher=eNews Channel Africa}}{{cite web |url=http://www.iol.co.za/news/crime-courts/reshalls-kuga-was-riddled-with-faults-says-family-7435556 |first=Jonisayi |last=Maromo |title=Reshall's Kuga was riddled with faults, says family |work=IOL |date=17 January 2017 |accessdate=18 January 2017 |location=Johannesburg |publisher=Independent Media}} Owners of models not included in the recall, but also damaged by fires, have expressed interest in joining such a suit.{{cite web |first=Graeme |last=Hosken |title=Not just recalled Kugas: Now other Ford models ablaze |work=Times Live |url=http://www.timeslive.co.za/thetimes/2017/01/19/Not-just-recalled-Kugas-Now-other-Ford-models-ablaze1 |publisher=Times Media Group |location=Johannesburg |date=19 January 2017 |accessdate=24 January 2017}} As of January 2018, Ford South Africa was offering affected owners a settlement, that included a [[non-disclosure agreement]], and was criticized both as inadequate and as an attempt to forestall the class action.{{cite web |first=Graeme |last=Hosken |title=Ford offers Kuga owners settlements to squash class action suit |work=Times Live |url=https://www.timeslive.co.za/news/south-africa/2018-01-12-ford-offers-kuga-owners-settlements-to-squash-class-action-suit/ |publisher=Times Media Group |location=Johannesburg |date=12 January 2018 |accessdate=5 February 2019}} On 2 March 2017, the National Consumer Commission (NCC) announced that it had begun an investigation into Ford South Africa's handling of the matter, after receiving numerous complaints alleging what the NCC described as "prohibited conduct".{{cite web |author= |title=SA consumer watchdog to probe Ford over Kuga |work=IOL |url=http://www.iol.co.za/motoring/industry-news/sa-consumer-watchdog-to-probe-ford-over-kuga-8008635 |publisher=Independent Media |location=Johannesburg |date=2 March 2017 |accessdate=2 March 2017}} The NCC report was completed by April 2018, at which time Ford South Africa was contacting affected owners with offers of compensation.{{cite web |first=Wendy |last=Knowler |title=Ford offers Kuga owners settlements ahead of consumer commission report |work=Times Live |url=https://www.timeslive.co.za/news/south-africa/2018-04-12-ford-offers-settlements-to-kuga-owners-as-consumer-commission-readies-report/ |publisher=Times Media Group |location=Johannesburg |date=12 April 2018 |accessdate=5 February 2019}} On 4 February 2019, an [[inquest]] into the death of the driver in December 2015 opened in the [[Western Cape Division|Western Cape]] [[High Court of South Africa|High Court]] at [[Cape Town]], and was postponed to 18 March 2019.{{cite web |author= |title=#FordKuga: Western Cape High Court hears inquiry into Reshall Jimmy's death |work=IOL |url=https://www.iol.co.za/capeargus/news/fordkuga-western-cape-high-court-hears-inquiry-into-reshall-jimmys-death-19121007 |publisher=Independent Media |location=Johannesburg |date=4 February 2019 |accessdate=5 February 2019}}{{cite web |first=Graeme |last=Hosken |title=Family hopes court case on Ford Kuga fires will bring justice |work=Times Live |url=https://www.timeslive.co.za/news/south-africa/2019-02-04-family-hopes-court-case-on-ford-kuga-fires-will-bring-justice/ |publisher=Times Media Group |location=Johannesburg |date=4 February 2019 |accessdate=5 February 2019}} During this initial hearing, [[Advocate#South_Africa|advocates]] for the various parties stated that some witness statements were outstanding, and made allegations about the circumstances of the death, the handling of the police investigation, and the conduct of Ford South Africa.{{cite web |first=Tammy |last=Petersen |title=Gunshots and 10-hour casino visits: Allegations fly before Jimmy inquest even starts |work=News24 |url=https://www.news24.com/SouthAfrica/News/gunshots-and-10-hour-casino-visits-allegations-fly-before-jimmy-inquest-even-starts-20190204 |publisher=24.com |location=Cape Town |date=4 February 2019 |accessdate=5 February 2019}}{{cite web |first=Graeme |last=Hosken |title=Ford's lawyers grilled at inquest into fiery death of Kuga owner |work=Times Live |url=https://www.timeslive.co.za/news/south-africa/2019-02-04-fords-lawyers-grilled-at-inquest-into-fiery-death-of-kuga-owner/ |publisher=Times Media Group |location=Johannesburg |date=4 February 2019 |accessdate=5 February 2019}} The outcome of the inquest would determine whether a [[National Prosecuting Authority|public]] or [[Private prosecution|private]] criminal prosecution might follow. ===== New Zealand ===== Television New Zealand reported that a Ford Kuga Titanium 2013 burst into flames in December 2016. The incident is being investigated by Ford NZ. Ford NZ say that the models being investigated in South Africa were built between 2012 and 2014 and fitted with a 1.6L EcoBoost engine. They also say there are differences between the models sold in South Africa and those sold in New Zealand. Until the investigation into the New Zealand incident has been completed, no decision can be made about recalling the 1,300 cars of the same model sold in New Zealand.{{Cite news|url=https://www.tvnz.co.nz/one-news/new-zealand/had-rip-car-seat-and-just-got-him-in-time-auckland-woman-reveals-terrifying-close-call-after-her-bursts-into-flames|title='I had to rip the car seat out and just got him out in time' – Auckland woman reveals terrifying close call after her car bursts into flames|newspaper=1 NEWS NOW|access-date=2017-02-01}} =={{anchor|third}}Third generation (2019–present)== {{Infobox automobile | name = Third generation | image = 2020 Ford Kuga ST-Line Plug-In Hybrid Front.jpg | aka = [[Ford Escape]] (North and Central America, Australia, China) | production = 2019–present | assembly = | designer = | platform = Ford C2 | layout = [[Front-engine, front-wheel-drive layout|Front-engine, front-wheel-drive]] or [[Front-engine, four-wheel-drive layout|four-wheel-drive]] | engine = 1.5 L ''[[Ford EcoBoost engine|EcoBoost]]'' [[inline-three engine|I3]]-[[turbocharger|T]] (petrol)
2.0 L ''[[Ford EcoBoost engine|EcoBoost]]'' [[inline-four engine|I4]]-T (petrol)
2.5 L I4 (hybrid)
2.5 L I4 (plug-in hybrid)
2.0 L ''[[Ford Duratorq engine|Duratorq]]'' I4-T (diesel) | transmission = 6-speed manual
8-speed automatic |related = {{ubl|[[Lincoln Corsair]] | [[Ford Escape]]}} |predecessor = [[Ford C-Max]] (for five-seater) | wheelbase = | length = | width = | height = | weight = }} The third generation Ford Kuga made its debut on April 2, 2019; it is scheduled to go sale in the third quarter of 2019 as a model for 2020 for markets in North America (as the fourth generation Escape for the region).{{Cite web|url=https://www.autocar.co.uk/car-news/new-cars/new-ford-kuga-revealed-fresh-design-and-hybrid-option|title=New Ford Kuga revealed with fresh design and hybrid option|work=[[Autocar (magazine)|Autocar]]|last=Holder|first=Jim|date=2 April 2019|accessdate=2 April 2019}}{{Cite web|url=https://www.caranddriver.com/news/a26996233/2020-ford-escape-photos-info/|title=The 2020 Ford Escape Looks to Fill a Car-Shaped Hole in the Lineup|work=[[Car and Driver]]|last=Capparella|first=Joey|date=2 April 2019|accessdate=2 April 2019}}{{Cite web|url=https://www.caranddriver.com/news/a27006951/2020-ford-escape-hybrid-plug-in-photos-info/|title=2020 Ford Escape Revives the Hybrid and Adds a Plug-In Variant|work=[[Car and Driver]]|last=Capparella|first=Joey|date=2 April 2019|accessdate=2 April 2019}} The newly designed Kuga has taken on a sleeker look and appears more aerodynamic, shedding up to two hundred pounds due to lighter, high strength steel. It also has sliding second row seats for more legroom. There will be five new engine transmission combinations, including a plug in gas electric hybrid that can go thirty miles on electricity, as well as a conventional hybrid and two turbocharged four cylinder engines mated to eight speed automatic transmissions. [[File:2020 Ford Kuga ST-Line Plug-In Hybrid Rear.jpg|thumb|Rear view]] [[File:Ford Kuga (third generation) at IAA 2019 IMG 0429.jpg|thumb|Interior]] {{clear}} == Name == The vehicle name, Kuga, is strongly reminiscent of the [[cougar]], which was the name of another Ford division's automobile, the [[Mercury Cougar]]. The final of the Cougar from 1998 to 2002 was sold outside of the United States as the Ford Cougar. == References == {{Reflist|30em}} == External links == {{Commons category}} * [http://www.ford.co.uk/Kuga Official website (UK)] * [https://web.archive.org/web/20110720161908/http://www.kuga.ford.eu/?locale=en_gb Official website (EU)] * [http://www.ford.com.au/suv/kuga Official website (Australia)] * [https://www.ford.co.za/suvs/kuga/ Official website (South Africa)] {{Modern European Ford vehicles}} {{FordEurope}} {{Ford Australia timeline}} {{Ford Motor Company vehicles}} [[Category:Ford vehicles|Kuga]] [[Category:Ford of Europe vehicles|Kuga]] [[Category:Compact sport utility vehicles]] [[Category:Ford C1 platform]] [[Category:Front-wheel-drive vehicles]] [[Category:Goods manufactured in Germany]] [[Category:Cars introduced in 2008]] [[Category:2000s cars]] [[Category:2010s cars]] [[Category:Crossover sport utility vehicles]]

[[Ford Romania|Bucharest, Romania]] |layout=[[FR layout]] |wheelbase= {{convert|112|in|mm|0|abbr=on}} |length = {{convert|4642|mm|in|1|abbr=on}} (3-Window Coupé){{cite web |title=1935 Ford Model 48 3-Window Coupé |url=https://www.carsized.com/en/index/ford/model-48/c3w/1935/ |website=Carsized.com |accessdate=4 August 2019}} |width = {{convert|1765|mm|in|1|abbr=on}} (3-Window Coupé){{cite web |title=1935 Ford Model 48 3-Window Coupé |url=https://www.carsized.com/en/index/ford/model-48/c3w/1935/ |website=Carsized.com |accessdate=4 August 2019}} |height = {{convert|1642|mm|in|1|abbr=on}} (3-Window Coupé){{cite web |title=1935 Ford Model 48 3-Window Coupé |url=https://www.carsized.com/en/index/ford/model-48/c3w/1935/ |website=Carsized.com |accessdate=4 August 2019}} |engine=221 CID (3.6 L) ''[[Ford flathead V8 engine|Flathead]]'' [[V8 engine|V8]] |body_style=2-door [[Roadster (automobile)|roadster]]

4-door [[station wagon]] }} The '''Model 48''' was an update on [[Ford Motor Company|Ford]]'s [[1932 Ford|V8-powered Model 40A]], the company's main product. Introduced in 1935, the Model 48 was given a cosmetic refresh annually, begetting the [[1937 Ford]] before being thoroughly redesigned for [[1941 Ford|1941]]. The 1935 Ford's combination of price, practicality, and looks vaulted the company ahead of rival [[Chevrolet]] for the sales crown that year, with 820,000 sold. ==1935== [[File:1935 Ford Model B Woodie.JPG|left|thumb|1935 Model B Woodie]] The 1935 Ford was a thorough refresh on the popular [[V8 engine|V8]]-powered Ford. The [[Straight-4|four-cylinder]] [[Ford Model A (1927)|Model A]] engine was no longer offered, leaving just the 221 CID (3.6 L) [[V8 engine|V8]] to power every Ford car and truck. The transverse [[leaf spring]] suspension remained, but the front spring was relocated ahead of the axle to allow more interior volume. The body was lowered and new "Center-Poise" seating improved comfort. Visually, the 1935 Ford was much more modern with the grille pushed forward and made more prominent by de-emphasized and more-integrated fenders. A major advance was a true integrated trunk on "trunkback" sedans, though the traditional "flatback" was also offered. Outdated body styles like the Victoria were also deleted for the year. The wooden panels were manufactured at the [[Ford Iron Mountain Plant]] in the Michigan Upper Peninsula from Ford owned lumber. Two trim lines were offered, standard and DeLuxe, across a number of body styles including a base [[Roadster (automobile)|roadster]], five-window [[coupe]], three-window coupe, Tudor and Fordor [[sedan (car)|sedans]] in flatback or trunkback versions, a convertible sedan, a woody [[station wagon]], and new '''Model 51''' truck. [[Rumble seat]]s were optional on coupe model. An oil pressure gauge (costing $4) and two windshield wipers were optional.{{cite web|url=http://www.oldcarbrochures.com/static/NA/Ford/1935_Ford/1935_Ford_Accessories/1935%20Ford%20Acc-04.html |title=Directory Index: Ford/1935_Ford/1935_Ford_Accessories |publisher=Oldcarbrochures.com |date= |accessdate=2012-05-31}} If one got the optional radio, it replaced the ash tray.{{cite web|url=http://www.oldcarbrochures.com/static/NA/Ford/1935_Ford/1935_Ford_Brochure/1935%20Ford-05.html |title=Directory Index: Ford/1935_Ford/1935_Ford_Brochure |publisher=Oldcarbrochures.com |date= |accessdate=2012-05-31}} ==1936== [[File:Fannin County Museum of History June 2017 09 (1936 Ford Model 48).jpg|thumb|left|1936 Ford Model 48 convertible]] [[File:1936 Ford V8 pickup Model 67, front left.jpg|thumb|left|1936 Ford Model 67 pickup truck]] Chevrolet regained the sales lead at the end of 1936, but the Ford still sold extremely well. A new club cabriolet model was introduced with a fully framed windshield and weatherproof top, and the convertible [[Sedan (automobile)|sedan]] gained the popular integrated trunkback design. The look was updated with an inverted pentagonal grille with all-vertical bars beneath a prominent hood and three horizontal chrome side strips (on DeLuxe models). The V8 DeLuxe was called '''Model 68.''' A concealed horn, long a prominent part of the Ford's design, also brought the car into modern times. The new trucks continued with the old grille. Other major changes for 1936 were the use of pressed steel "artillery" solid wheels instead of wire wheels. [[File:1936 Ford V8 Deluxe Convertible Sedan in Armory Green, front left (Hershey 2019).jpg|thumb|left|1936 Ford V8 DeLuxe Convertible Sedan (Model 68)]] == 1938 == In 1938, Ford announced new styling for its cars.{{cite web|url=http://www.oldcarbrochures.com/static/NA/Ford/1938_Ford/1938_Ford_Folder/1938%20Ford%20Folder-03.html |title=Directory Index: Ford/1938_Ford/1938_Ford_Folder |publisher=Oldcarbrochures.com |date= |accessdate=2011-11-20}} Only a V8 was offered, either a {{convert|60|hp|kW|0|abbr=on}} V8 or an {{convert|85|hp|kW|0|abbr=on}} V8.{{cite web|url=http://www.oldcarbrochures.com/static/NA/Ford/1938_Ford/1938_Ford_Folder/1938%20Ford%20Folder-06.html |title=Directory Index: Ford/1938_Ford/1938_Ford_Folder |publisher=Oldcarbrochures.com |date= |accessdate=2011-11-20}} A new dash was used, with recessed controls for safety. {{clear}} ==Sources== {{reflist}} * {{cite book|title=100 Years of Ford|author=David L. Lewis|isbn=0-7853-7988-6|publisher=Publications International|year=2005|pages=81–89}} * {{cite web|url=http://www.edmunds.com/insideline/do/Features/articleId=93327|title=Generations: Ford Model T to Crown Victoria|work=[[Edmunds.com]]|accessdate=August 21, 2006}} {{Early Ford cars}} {{Ford}} [[Category:Ford vehicles|Model 78]] [[Category:Rear-wheel-drive vehicles]] [[Category:1930s cars]] [[Category:Sedans]] [[Category:Motor vehicles manufactured in the United States]] ==External links== {{Commons category}} *[https://www.carsized.com/en/ Carsized] Website for comparing car dimensions featuring early Ford vehicles incl. | engine = 201 CID (3.3 L) [[Flathead engine|L-head]] [[Inline-four engine|I4]] | wheelbase = {{convert|103.5|in|mm|0|abbr=on}}{{cite book|last=Kimes|first=Beverly|title=standard catalog of American Cars 1805-1942|year=1996|publisher=Krause publications|isbn=0-87341-428-4}} | length = {{convert|165|in|mm|0|abbr=on}} | width = {{convert|67|in|mm|0|abbr=on}} | height = | weight = {{convert|2265|lb|kg|0|abbr=on}} | aka = | transmission = 3-speed sliding gear [[Manual transmission|manual]] | related = [[Ford Model AF]]
[[Ford Model AA]] | designer = }} The '''Ford Model A''' (also colloquially called the '''A-Model Ford''' or the '''A''', and '''A-bone''' among [[Hot rod#Language|rodders]] and [[Custom car#Language|customizers]])Bianco, Johnny, "Leadfest" in ''Rod & Custom'', 9/00, p. 86. was the [[Ford Motor Company]]'s second market success after its predecessor, the [[Ford Model T|Model T]]. First produced on October 20, 1927, but not introduced until December 2,{{Cite book |url=https://books.google.com/books?id=2bcW0WDEKgMC&pg=PA10 |title=Collector's Originality Guide Ford Model A |last=Schild |first=Jim |publisher=MotorBooks International |year=2009 |isbn=9781610608886 |language=en}} it replaced the venerable Model T, which had been produced for 18 years. This new Model A ([[Ford Model A (1903–1904)|a previous model]] had used the name in 1903–04) was designated a 1928 model and was available in four standard colors. By February 4, 1929, one million Model As had been sold, and by July 24, two million.Gauld, p. 693. The range of body styles ran from the Tudor at US$500 (in grey, green, or black) to the Town Car with a dual cowl at US$1200.Gauld, p. 694. In March 1930, Model A sales hit three million, and there were nine body styles available. Model A production ended in March 1932, after 4,858,644 had been made in all body styles.{{cite web|url=https://www.mafca.com/data_production.html|title=Model A Production Figures|publisher=Model A Ford Club of America|accessdate=April 12, 2015}} Its successor was the [[Ford Model B (1932)|Model B]], which featured an updated [[Inline-four engine|inline four-cylinder engine]], as well as the [[1932 Ford#Model 18|Model 18]], which introduced Ford's new [[Ford flathead V8 engine|flathead (sidevalve) V8 engine]]. ==Features== Prices for the Model A ranged from US$385 for a roadster to US$1400 for the top-of-the-line ''Town Car.'' The engine was a water-cooled [[Cam-in-block#L-head|L-head]] inline four with a displacement of {{convert|201|CID|l|1|abbr=on}}.{{cite book|last1=Cheetham|first1=Craig|title=Vintage Cars - The Finest Prewar Automobiles|date=2004|publisher=Grange Books|location=Rochester, United Kingdom|isbn=1840136359|pages=31}} This engine provided {{convert|40|hp|kW PS|abbr=on}}. Top speed was around {{convert|65|mph|km/h|abbr=on}}. The Model A had a {{convert|103.5|in|mm|abbr=on}} wheelbase with a final drive ratio of 3.77:1. The transmission was a conventional unsynchronized three-speed sliding gear [[Manual transmission|manual]] with a single speed reverse. The Model A had four-wheel [[Mechanical brake|mechanical]] [[drum brake]]s. The 1930 and 1931 models were available with stainless steel radiator cowling and headlamp housings. The Model A came in a wide variety of styles including a [[Coupe]] (Standard and Deluxe), Business Coupe, Sport Coupe, Roadster Coupe (Standard and Deluxe), Convertible [[Cabriolet (automobile)|Cabriolet]], Convertible [[Sedan (car)|Sedan]], Phaeton (Standard and Deluxe), Tudor [[Sedan (car)|Sedan]] (Standard and Deluxe), Town Car, Fordor (five-window standard, three-window deluxe), Victoria, Town Sedan, Station Wagon, Taxicab, Truck, and Commercial.{{citation needed|date=July 2015}} The very rare Special Coupe started production around March 1928 and ended mid-1929. The Model A was the first Ford to use the standard set of driver controls with conventional clutch and brake pedals, throttle, and gearshift. Previous Fords used controls that had become uncommon to drivers of other makes. The Model A's fuel tank was situated in the cowl, between the engine compartment's fire wall and the dash panel. It had a visual fuel gauge, and the fuel flowed to the carburetor by gravity. A rear-view mirror was optional. In cooler climates, owners could purchase an [[Aftermarket (automotive)|aftermarket]] cast iron unit to place over the exhaust manifold to provide heat to the cab. A small door provided adjustment of the amount of hot air entering the cab. The Model A was the first car to have [[Laminated glass|safety glass]] in the windshield.{{cite web|url=http://www.oldcarbrochures.com/static/NA/Ford/1930_Ford/1930_Ford_Brochure_02/1930%20Ford-14-15.html |title=Directory Index: Ford/1930_Ford/1930_Ford_Brochure_02 |publisher=Oldcarbrochures.com |date= |accessdate=November 20, 2011}} The [[Soviet Union|Soviet]] company [[GAZ]], which started as a [[joint venture]] between Ford and the Soviet Union, made a licensed version from 1932–1936.{{Harvnb|Sorensen|1956|pp=206–208}}. This served as the basis for the [[FAI armoured car|FAI]] and [[BA-20]] [[Armored car (military)|armored car]]s which saw use as Soviet scout vehicles in the early stages of [[World War II]]. In addition to the [[United States]], Ford made the Model A in plants in [[Argentina]], [[Canada]], [[Denmark]], [[France]], [[Germany]], [[Italy]], [[Japan]] and the [[United Kingdom]]. In Europe, where in some countries cars were taxed according to engine size, [[Ford of Britain|Ford in the UK]] manufactured the Model A with a smaller displacement engine of {{convert|2043|cc|abbr=on}}, providing a claimed output of {{convert|28|hp|kW PS|abbr=on}}.Werner Oswald. ''Deutsche Autos 1920-1945'' p. 416 {{ISBN|3-87943-519-7}} However, this equated to a British [[Tax horsepower|fiscal horsepower]] of {{convert|14.9|hp|kW PS|lk=on|abbr=on}}Clutton, Cecil, Paul Bird and Anthony Harding. ''The Vintage Car Pocketbook'' ; ''The Motoring Encyclopaedia'' (1935?) (compared to the {{convert|24|hp|kW PS|lk=on|abbr=on}} of the larger engine) and attracted a punitive annual car tax levy of £1 per fiscal hp in the UK. It therefore was expensive to own and too heavy and uneconomical to achieve volume sales, and so unable to compete in the newly developing mass market, while also too crude to compete as a luxury product. European manufactured Model As failed to achieve the sales success in Europe that would greet their [[Ford Model Y|smaller successor]] in Britain and Germany.{{cite journal| authorlink = David Johns (Editor in chief)| title = 0 – 100...We celebrate a century of Ford in style....| journal = Auto Express| volume = Issue 724| pages = 56–62|date = October 2–8, 2002| ref = harv}} ==Development history== From the mid 1910s through the early 1920s, Ford dominated the automotive market with its Model T. However, during the mid-1920s, this dominance eroded as competitors, especially the various General Motors divisions, caught up with Ford's mass production system and began to better Ford in some areas, especially by offering more powerful engines, new convenience features, or cosmetic customization.{{Harvnb|Sorensen|1956|pp=217–219}}.{{Harvnb|Hounshell|1984|pp=263–264}}.{{Harvnb|Sloan|1964|pp=162–163}}. Also, features [[Henry Ford]] considered to be unnecessary, such as [[Starter motor|electric starters]], were gradually shifting in the public's perception from luxuries to essentials. Ford's sales force recognized the threat and advised Henry to respond to it. Initially he resisted, but the T's sagging market share finally forced him to admit a replacement was needed. When he finally agreed to begin development of this new model, he focused on the mechanical aspects and on what today is called [[design for manufacturability]] (DFM), which he had always strongly embraced and for which the Model T production system was famous. Although ultimately successful, the development of the Model A included many problems that had to be resolved.{{Harvnb|Hounshell|1984|pp=280–292}}. For example, the [[Die (manufacturing)|die stamping of parts from sheet steel]], which the Ford company had led to new heights of development with the Model T production system, was something Henry had always been ambivalent about; it had brought success, but he felt that it was not the best choice for durability. He was determined that the Model A would rely more on [[drop forging]]s than the Model T, but his ideas to improve the DFM of forging did not prove practical. Eventually, Ford's engineers persuaded him to relent, lest the Model A's production cost force up its retail price too much.{{Harvnb|Hounshell|1984|pp=280–281}}. Henry's disdain for cosmetic vanity as applied to automobiles led him to leave the Model A's styling to a team led by his son [[Edsel Ford|Edsel]], even though he would take credit for it despite his son doing more of the work. It was during the period from the mid-1920s to early 1930s that the limits of the first generation of [[mass production]], epitomized by the Model T production system's rigidity, became apparent. The era of "[[Flexible manufacturing system|flexible mass production]]" had begun.{{Harvnb|Hounshell|1984|pp=263–301}}, Chapter 7: Cul-de-sac: The Limits of [[Fordism]] & the Coming of "Flexible Mass Production".{{Harvnb|Sorensen|1956|pp=217–231}}, Chapter 16: Farewell to Model T. ==Film and media== The Model A was well represented in media of the era since it was one of the most common cars. [[Model kit]]s remain available from hobby shops as stock cars or [[hot rod]]s. Several Model As have obtained particular fame. The "Mean Green Machine", a green and black 1931 Tudor Sedan, has been a staple of [[University of North Texas]] football games and special events since 1974, maintained by the spirit organization Talons since the 1980s. The [[Ramblin' Wreck]], a 1930 Sport Coupe, is the official mascot of the student body at the [[Georgia Institute of Technology]] and appears at sporting events and student body functions. [[Ala Kart (custom car)|''Ala Kart'']], a [[custom car|customized]] 1929 [[roadster pickup]] built by [[George Barris (auto customizer)|George Barris]], won two straight "[[America's Most Beautiful Roadster]]" awards at the [[Oakland Roadster Show]] before making numerous film and television appearances. Between October 1992 and December 1994, Hector Quevedo, along with his son Hugo, drove a 1928 Model A {{convert|22,000|mi|km|0|abbr=on}} from his home in [[Punta Arenas]], [[Chile]] to Ford headquarters in [[Dearborn, Michigan]]. The car required minimal service, including a flat tire and transmission work in [[Nicaragua]], and is now housed in the [[The Henry Ford|Henry Ford Museum]].Cardinale, Anthony. "Chileans on a Roll in Vintage Car Trek Detroit-Bound Model A Ford Arrives Here After 21,700 Miles". ''Buffalo News''. Buffalo, N.Y.: November 30, 1994, p. A.1. Charlie Ryan's song "[[Hot Rod Lincoln]]" featured a modified Model A. The song has been [[Cover version|covered]] several times since its original release. ==Gallery== File:1928-ford-archives.jpg|1928 Model A Business Coupe File:Ford_A_de_Luxe_Roadster_blue_vrd.jpg|1930 Deluxe Roadster File:1931_Ford_Model_A_roadster_engine.JPG|1928 Model A engine with modern [[Aftermarket (automotive)|aftermarket]] air filter File:1929_Ford_Model_AA_Truck_DGO099.jpg|1929 Model AA heavy-duty truck variant of the Model A File:1928 Ford Model A 76A Open Cab.jpg|1928 Model A open-cab (roadster) pickup File:1931 Ford Model A Deluxe Tudor.jpg|1931 Deluxe Tudor File:'28 Ford Model A Hotrod (Auto classique St. Lazare '10).jpg|1928 Model A [[hot rod]] with roll pan, [[Hot rod#Language|chopped top]], and late-model headlights and mirrors File:'31 Ford Model A (Auto classique).JPG|Another [[hot rod]] with 1931 Roadster body and chassis,{{citation needed|date=October 2010}} [[Hot rod#Language|Deuce]] grille shell, chrome-hatted [[carburetor]]s, drilled I-beam dropped front axle, finned drum brakes, and [[Hot rod#Language|zoomie pipes]] File:HFM Chile to Michigan 1928 Model A Ford.jpg|Hector Quevedo's 1928 Model A on display at the Henry Ford Museum. File:1929_Ford_Model_A_Gazogene.jpg|1929 Model A Gazogene on display at the [[Tampa Bay Automobile Museum]]. This car was modified in 1939 to use an alternative fuel in the form of wood or charcoal. File:Ford_Model_A_1928_Wood_Gas_01.jpg|1928 Model A Fordor with a 1941 Kaiser [[wood gas generator]].{{cn|date=April 2018}} File:1929 Ford Model A Station Wagon.jpg|A 1929 Model A station wagon, on display at the [[Museum of Automobiles]] in Arkansas. File:Ford Model A Town Car.jpg|1929 Town Car from The Museum of Automobiles in Arkansas. File:1928 Ford Model A in Bucharest.jpg|1928 sedan with [[suicide doors]] in [[Romania]]. [[Ford Laser]] }} The current generation '''Ford Escort''' is a [[compact car]] sold on the [[China|Chinese]] and [[Taiwan|Taiwanese]] market by the [[Ford Motor Company]]. Following its announcement in mid-2013 that they intended reviving the "Escort" name for a car based on an older version of the [[Ford Focus]], Ford launched the new Escort in January 2015.{{cite web|url=http://www.carnewschina.com/2015/01/05/ford-escort-launched-on-the-chinese-auto-market/|title=Ford Escort launched on the Chinese auto market|accessdate=2015-10-21|date=2015-01-05}}__NOTOC__ ==History and lineage== Ford had used the Escort name on three earlier car lines; firstly on a [[Ford Escort (Squire-based estate)|variant of the Ford Squire]] sold in the UK 1955 to 1961, then on the better-known [[Ford Escort (Europe)|European Ford Escort]] sold from 1968 to 2001, and the [[Ford Escort (North America)|North American Ford Escort]] sold between 1980 and 2003. In 2013, Ford announced its intention to resurrect the "Escort" nameplate on the Chinese market in 2014, with a [[compact car]] based on the then-current Ford Focus Classic, itself a version of the second generation of [[Ford Focus]]. The Chinese Escort was intended to be the technical successor of the Focus Classic and positioned under the current third generation Ford Focus. {{cite web|url=http://www.carnewschina.com/2013/07/25/new-ford-escort-will-hit-the-china-car-market-in-2014/ |title=New Ford Escort will hit the China car market in 2014 |publisher=CarNewsChina.com |author=Tycho de Feijter |date=2013-07-25 |accessdate=2013-08-29}} When launched, the [[Ford Focus (first generation)|first generation Ford Focus]] had itself been the replacement for both the European and the North American Escort lines in their respective markets. ==Reception== The UK magazine and website ''[[Autocar (magazine)|Autocar]]'' gave the Escort three out of five stars, expressing surprise that the Escort name had been revived for a market where it had no heritage and commenting that "the Escort name is from another age [and] essentially it is a cheap car cobbled together from Ford’s parts bin". They also noted that the suspension had been tweaked to suit Chinese road conditions, but stated that they did not think it seemed cheap enough for the intended market.{{cite web|url=http://www.autocar.co.uk/car-review/ford/escort|title=Ford Escort review|accessdate=2015-10-21|quote=The name is a surprising choice as none of the original Escorts were ever officially sold in China [so] there is no heritage [..] suspension settings are on the soft side to compensate for China's poor road conditions. [..] The Escort name is from another age [and] essentially it is a cheap car cobbled together from Ford’s parts bin [..] it just doesn’t seem cheap enough.|publisher=Autocar|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160304194351/https://www.autocar.co.uk/car-review/ford/escort|archivedate=2016-03-04}} ==Gallery== Ford Escort CN 02 -- Auto China -- 2014-04-23.jpg|Side view Ford Escort CN 03 -- Auto China -- 2014-04-23.jpg|Rear end Ford Escort CN China 2015-04-10.jpg|Front end - white color Ford Escort facelift 001.jpg|2019 facelift front end Ford Escort facelift 002.jpg|2019 facelift rear end ==References== {{Reflist}} {{Ford vehicles}} [[Category:Ford vehicles|Escort]] [[Category:Front-wheel-drive vehicles]] [[Category:Sedans]] [[Category:Compact cars]] [[Category:2010s cars]] [[Category:Cars of China]]

{{Advert|date=October 2019}} {{Use mdy dates|date=May 2011}} {{Infobox automobile |name=Ford Fusion Hybrid |image=Ford Fusion Hybrid Brazil 10 2015 BSB 471.JPG |manufacturer=[[Ford Motor Company|Ford]] |production=2008–present |model_years=2010–present |class=[[Mid-size car|Mid-size]] |layout=[[FF layout]] |assembly=[[Hermosillo, Sonora]], Mexico |body_style=4-door [[sedan (automobile)|sedan]] }} The '''Ford Fusion Hybrid''' is a [[hybrid electric vehicle|gasoline-electric hybrid]] powered version of the [[mid-size car|mid-sized]] [[Ford Fusion (Americas)|Ford Fusion]] [[sedan (automobile)|sedan]] manufactured and marketed by [[Ford Motor Company|Ford]], now in its second generation. A [[plug-in hybrid]] version, the '''Ford Fusion Energi''', was released in the U.S. in February 2013.{{cite news |url=http://pricinginsider.carsdirect.com/2013/02/27/2013-ford-fusion-energi-fuel-economy-pricing-and-release-date/ |title=2013 Ford Fusion Energi: Fuel Economy, Pricing and Release Date |author=Jesse Sears |publisher=Cars Direc |date=February 27, 2013 |accessdate=March 3, 2013 |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130305135302/http://pricinginsider.carsdirect.com/2013/02/27/2013-ford-fusion-energi-fuel-economy-pricing-and-release-date/ |archivedate=March 5, 2013 |df=mdy }}{{cite news |url=https://insideevs.com/february-2013-plug-in-electric-vehicle-sales-report-card/ |title=February 2013 Plug-In Electric Vehicle Sales Report Card |author=Jay Cole |publisher=Inside EVs |date=March 3, 2013 |accessdate=March 4, 2013 |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130304012451/http://insideevs.com/february-2013-plug-in-electric-vehicle-sales-report-card/ |archivedate=March 4, 2013 |df=mdy }} The first generation was launched to the U.S. market in March 2009 for [[model year]] 2010, together with its [[badge engineering|badge-engineered]] variants, the '''Mercury Milan Hybrid''' and the [[Lincoln MKZ#MKZ Hybrid (2011)|Lincoln MKZ Hybrid]]. The second generation was launched under the Ford and Lincoln brands for model year 2013, went on sale in the U.S. in October 2012. The [[U.S. Environmental Protection Agency]] (EPA) rated the 2010 Ford Fusion Hybrid at {{convert|39|mpgus|abbr=on}} combined city/highway. The second generation hybrid improved the fuel economy rating to {{convert|42|mpgus|abbr=on}} for combined city/highway driving. The EPA rated the Energi's combined city/highway fuel economy in [[all-electric mode]] at 88 [[miles per gallon gasoline equivalent]] (MPG-e) (2.7 L gasoline equivalent/100 km; 106 mpg-imp). In hybrid operation ([[charge-sustaining]] mode), the Energi has a combined fuel economy of {{convert|38|mpgUS|abbr=on}}. The Fusion Hybrid has won the 2010 [[North American Car of the Year]] Award, and the entire [[Ford Fusion (Americas)#Second generation (2013–)|2013 Ford Fusion line-up]], including the Fusion hybrid and plug-in variants, won the 2013 [[Green Car of the Year]]. {{As of|2016|12}}, over 285,000 units of the Fusion hybrid family have been sold in the United States since 2009, including the plug-in hybrid variant. {{As of|2016|12}}, sales of the Fusion Energi totaled 43,327 units delivered in its main market, the U.S. ==First generation== {{Infobox automobile |name=First generation |platform=[[Ford CD3 platform]] |image=Tino Rossini's Reviews - 011 - 2010 Ford Fusion Hybrid.jpg |production=December 2008–2012 |model_years=2010–2012 |engine='''Gasoline''':

[[Ford Fusion (Americas)|Ford Fusion]] }} ===History and development=== The [[hybrid vehicle|hybrid electric]] version of the [[Ford Fusion (Americas)|Fusion]] was announced at the 2005 [[North American International Auto Show]], along with the public introduction of the original 2006 Fusion. At that time Ford announced that the hybrid version was scheduled to be introduced in early 2009 for the 2010 model year, for a [[suggested retail price]] of US$27,270.{{cite news|url=http://info.detnews.com/autosinsider/sneakpeek/index.cfm?id=26578 |title=Ford Fusion hybrid to hit auto show circuit soon |publisher=DetroitNews.com |date=August 15, 2007 |accessdate=November 18, 2007 |archiveurl=https://archive.today/20071011173737/http://info.detnews.com/autosinsider/sneakpeek/index.cfm?id=26578 |archivedate=October 11, 2007 |url-status=dead |df=mdy }}{{cite news|url=http://www.caranddriver.com/carnews/13741/spied-2009-ford-fusion.html?al=99|title=Spied: 2009 Ford Fusion – Car News|publisher=Car and Driver|date=August 2007|accessdate=November 18, 2007|last=Gluckman|first=David}} The new Fusion Hybrid and Fusion Sport officially debuted at the [[Greater Los Angeles Auto Show]] in November 2008.{{cite web |url=http://www.worldcarfans.com/9081110.034/2010-ford-fusion-hybrid-to-pace-nascar-sprint-cup |title=2010 Ford Fusion Hybrid to pace NASCAR Sprint Cup |work=WorldCarFans.com |date=November 11, 2008 |publisher=Black Falcon Media Group}} The Fusion Hybrid is manufactured at Ford's [[Hermosillo Stamping & Assembly]] plant, located in [[Sonora]], Mexico. Ford set a modest sales target of about 25,000 vehicles a year for the Fusion Hybrid and the similar [[Mercury Milan]].{{cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2008/12/31/business/31ford.html?scp=2&sq=Prius%20Fusion%20Hybrid&st=cse|title=Ford Hybrid Emphasizes High Mileage |work=New York Times |author=Bill Vlasic|date=December 30, 2008|accessdate=June 6, 2009}} [[File:Fusion vs Milan Hybrids.jpg|thumb|left|The Milan and Fusion hybrids share the same [[powertrain]] but feature different front and rear fascia designs, and distinct headlamps and taillights.]] The Fusion Hybrid was made available for press testing in December 2008 and launched to the U.S. market in March 2009. During the same month two other new hybrid models also came on sale, the [[Honda Insight]] and the [[Mercury Milan Hybrid|Mercury Milan]].{{cite web|url=http://www.greencarcongress.com/2009/04/us-hybrid-sales-in-march-2009-down-44-yearonyear-monthly-new-vehicle-market-share-of-25.html#more|title=US Hybrid Sales in March 2009 Down 44% Year-on-Year; Monthly New Vehicle Market Share of 2.5%|publisher=[[Green Car Congress]]|date=April 3, 2009|accessdate=June 6, 2009}} During the few days that were available to the public, Ford's new Fusion and Milan hybrids sold a combined 451 units, representing 3.0% of all Fusion and Milan models sold in March 2009. The Fusion is the first new hybrid vehicle the Ford brand offered in five years, and is the second hybrid vehicle after the [[Ford Escape Hybrid]]. The Ford Fusion and Mercury Milan hybrids join the [[Saturn Vue|Saturn Vue Green Line Hybrid]] for Mexican-built hybrid vehicles.{{Citation needed|date=June 2009}} The [[Lincoln MKZ Hybrid|2011 Lincoln MKZ Hybrid]], launched in the U.S. market in September 2010, shares the hybrid powertrain from the Ford Fusion and Mercury Milan hybrids, and delivers an estimated [[Fuel economy in automobiles|fuel economy]] of {{convert|41|mpgUS|abbr=on}}. The MKZ Hybrid offers several improvements of Ford's Smart Gauge with EcoGuide, first introduced in the 2010 Fusion Hybrid.{{cite web|url=http://www.motortrend.com/auto_shows/new_york/2010/1003_2011_lincoln_mkz_hybrid/index.html|title=2011 Lincoln MKZ Hybrid |publisher=[[Motor Trend]]|date=March 2010|author=Mike Floyd|accessdate=April 5, 2010}}{{cite web|url=http://www.greencarcongress.com/2010/03/mkzhybrid-20100330.html|title=Ford Introduces 2011 Lincoln MKZ Hybrid; Projected 41 mpg City|publisher=[[Green Car Congress]] |date=March 31, 2010|accessdate=April 5, 2010}} ===Design and technology=== The Fusion Hybrid is a [[Hybrid vehicle drivetrains#Full Hybrids|"full" hybrid]] because both propulsion sources, an electric motor powered by a [[Sanyo]] supplied{{cite web|last=Abuelsamid |first=Sam |url=http://www.autobloggreen.com/2008/10/30/tech-analysis-2010-ford-fusion-mercury-milan-powertrains-38-mp/2 |title=Tech Analysis: 2010 Ford Fusion/Mercury Milan powertrains, 38 mpg hybrid! – Autoblog Green |publisher=Autobloggreen.com |date=October 30, 2008 |accessdate=October 17, 2009}} 275 [[Volt|V]] [[nickel-metal hydride battery]], and a 2.5L [[Atkinson cycle]] [[Straight-4|I4]] 156 hp 136 ft.lbs.{{citation needed|date=October 2011}} gasoline engine with intake variable cam timing(iVCT), have substantial power ratings and either can be used alone to propel the vehicle.{{cite web|url=http://media.ford.com/images/10031/2010_Ford_Fusion_Hybrid.pdf |title=2010 Ford Fusion |publisher=[[Ford Motor Company]] |accessdate=June 6, 2009 |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090419095038/http://media.ford.com/images/10031/2010_Ford_Fusion_Hybrid.pdf |archivedate=April 19, 2009 }}{{cite web|url=http://www.fordvehicles.com/cars/fusion/features/specs/|title=Fusion Especifications|publisher=[[Ford Motor Company]]|accessdate=June 6, 2009|url-status=dead|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090712044236/http://www.fordvehicles.com/cars/fusion/features/specs/|archivedate=July 12, 2009|df=mdy-all}} ''See boxes "Gas Engine Specifications (Hybrid Model)" and "Electric Motor Specifications (Hybrid Model)"'' When braking or decelerating, the Fusion's hybrid system uses [[regenerative braking]], where the electric drive motor becomes a generator, converting the vehicle's momentum back to electricity for storage in the batteries. Ford claims that nearly 94 percent energy recovery is achieved by first delivering full regenerative braking followed by friction brakes during city driving. Under ideal conditions, Ford claims the Fusion Hybrid can cruise {{convert|2|mi}} at up to {{convert|47|mph}} on battery power alone.{{cite news|url=http://www.hybridcars.com/vehicle/ford-fusion-hybrid.html|title=Ford Fusion Hybrid|publisher=Hybrid Cars|accessdate=June 6, 2009}} Once perceived as a laggard in hybrid technology, Ford now claims nearly 500 hybrid patents that allow the Fusion Hybrid to achieve 41 MPG on the highway. According to Hybridcars.com, Ford has pointed to its talented inventors, making "special mention of Ming Kuang who has helped Ford since 2000 to expand its portfolio of hybrid patents from just 10 patents when he began to 461 today." Quoted in Autotrader.com, the veteran engineer says "it's about helping make the world my children live in-and the world my children's children will live in-a better place." ===Safety=== The [[Ford
